184501.name: d6 Hero (3Muse)
184501.description:
d6 Hero - Truth, Justice, & Men in Red Spandex

User summary:

The rules presented in d6 Hero adapt the generic, universal d6 RPG rules to a superhero genre. Characters have one additional Attribute, namely Reaction Adjustment--this helps the hero when they interact with the press, police, or even alien beings. Super powers are assigned a "Level", indicating a dice roll (e.g., 1d6 or 2d3). This Level indicates the amount of damage caused or prevented by the power. The document presents several types of powers and discusses how super heroes might acquire their powers and status.

184502.name: Bluff
184502.description:
Bluff is a traditional card game which could be called a card version of Liar's Dice. Players are dealt hands of only one card each and bid for poker hands that are present in all players hands' combined.

During a turn the player can raise the bid or challenge. If challenge succeded, then the bidder gets plus one card at the start of each consecutive turn. If challenge failed, then the challenger gets plus one card at the start of each consecutive turn.

The game ends when one player gets her 5th-10th card (depending on the number of players). Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner.

184503.name: Giantslayer Adventure Path Pawn Collection
184503.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Key monsters and NPCs from the Giantslayer Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with the Giantslayer Pawn Collection, featuring more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or an NPC from the Giantslayer campaign, including orcs, dragons, giants of all types, and dozens of unique pawns also suitable for representing player characters. The Giantslayer Pawn Collection, together with the creatures from the Pathfinder Pawns: Bestiary Box collections, provides pawns for nearly every Giantslayer encounter. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from any of the Bestiary Box collections, making the pawns easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With tons of distinct images, the Giantslayer Pawn Collection brings to life the enemies and allies from all six adventures of the Giantslayer Adventure Path.

Battle of Bloodmarch Hill
The Hill Giant's Pledge
Forge of the Giant God
Ice Tomb of the Giant Queen
Anvil of Fire
Shadow of the Storm Tyrant
The enemies and allies of the Giantslayer Adventure Path come to life on your tabletop! Each has its own abbreviation and identification number for easy sorting.

184504.name: Zobrist Cube
184504.description:
Zobrist cubes are similar to the classic "Soma Cube" puzzle, except that there are many more 3d shapes having sizes up to 5 small cubes. There are enough pieces in the set to simultaneously construct 5 3x3x3 cubes.

The set comes with a code book containing thousands of codes, each of which specifies a set of pieces from which a 3x3x3 cube can be constructed.

The competitive version is to race another player to construct a cube with similar difficulty, but different pieces.

184505.description:
From the publisher's website:

Panzer Grenadier covers dozens of topics with thousands of scenarios. Invasion 1944 is your gateway to that world.

Based on the battles waged by American troops in the days following the landings in Normandy, Invasion 1944 is specifically designed to introduce new players to the Panzer Grenadier system. Each player commands the troops, tanks and artillery of the U.S Army and the German Wehrmacht, using leaders to activate and move forces.

There are twenty-one scenarios (separate battle situations) depicting the fighting, presented in graduated fashion – you only need to learn some of the rules to play the first few scenarios, then some more rules for some more involved scenarios, and so on. Panzer Grenadier is already a pretty easy game system to learn how to play, and with Invasion 1944 it’s even easier.

There’s plenty here for veteran Panzer Grenadier players, too: Two new maps by Guy Riessen, depicting the bocage and farmlands of Normandy. 176 new playing pieces (including units, leaders and markers). Twenty-one new scenarios by ace designer Mike Perryman, most of them based on actions of the U.S. Army’s 29th “Blue and Gray” Infantry Division.
184505.name: Panzer Grenadier: Invasion 1944

184506.description:
From the publisher's website:

Japanese troops landed in northeastern New Guinea in July 1942, and quickly began a march over the forbidding Owen Stanley Mountains toward the vital anchorage and airfield at Port Moresby on the southern coast. They ran into Australian infantrymen of the 39th Militia Battalion, starting a three-month campaign waged in some of the world's most forbidding terrain.

An Australian militia brigade went up the trail to face the Japanese, who poured in reinforcements of their own. Next the veteran Australian 7th Infantry Division, the heroes of Tobruk, plunged into the jungles and finally stopped the Japanese attacks. While Australian soldiers fought on despite rampant malaria, Japanese troops hauled artillery shells over the mountains by hand and resorted to eating Australian prisoners of war. Finally in September 1942 the Japanese withdrew from one of the war's most brutal campaigns.

The Kokoda Campaign is a complete boxed game in the Panzer Grenadier series. Based on these battles, it includes the two maps that appeared in our old Kokoda Trail book and 242 playing pieces that originally appeared in our out-of-print Guadalcanal and Afrika Korps games. It has 30 scenarios originally designed by Dave Cheever and re-worked by Matt Ward and Daniel Rouleau, plus a campaign game.
184506.name: Panzer Grenadier: The Kokoda Campaign

184507.name: Skirmish Wars: Colonize
184507.description: Skirmish Wars: Colonize is a standalone adaptation of Skirmish Wars: Advance Tactics. Skirmish Wars is a tactical print-and-play wargame that uses printable, customizable maps for endless variety and simple mechanics to streamline gameplay. The game is based on Advance Wars, a videogame by Intelligent Systems.

184508.description:
The Award Winning Game plunges you into the hellish underbelly of the advertising industry… where clients have horns, deadlines are always an hour away and showing a little cleavage wins you accounts.

From humble beginnings, you and your friends will run your own ad agencies, working (and sabotaging) your way up to hiring the world’s most pretentious creatives, and winning accounts from famous brands… only to throw them away for the shot at winning awards.

Because, y’know, who needs clients when you’ve got prestige?
184508.name: The Award Winning Game

184509.name: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

rpg.28323: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

rpgpodcastepisode.184960: Mutant Crawl Classics: The Museum at the End of Time

184509.description:
From the publisher's site:

Triumph & Technology Won by Mutants & Magic

You’re no zero.

You’re a wasteland wanderer: a mutant, a seeker, a robot-killer, a stoic shaman guarding forgotten ancient sciences. You seek triumph and technology, winning it with mutations and magic, soaked in the radiation and quantum fields of the mutated, the savage, the semi-sentient, and the artificially intelligent. There are treasures to be won in the taboo lands and ruins, and you shall have them.

Return to the glory days of science fiction gaming with the Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure like it’s 1978 again, with modern rules grounded in the origins of post-apocalyptic role playing. Fast play, a mysterious future, and 100% compatibility with the DCC RPG system await you — just activate your artifact...

184510.name: Word Topper
184510.description:
Word Topper is a great way to build your vocabulary while having fun with your friends and family! Use as much word building strategy as possible to try and score the most points on every turn.

GAME PLAY

Word Topper is quick to set up and easy to play. The more times you play, the more words and combinations you will learn to make.

Start by choosing a dealer. The dealer deals out six cards to every player. After the deal is over, the dealer puts the rest of the deck face down to create a draw pile. He then draws 7 cards and places them face up in the middle of the table creating the community cards for everyone to play off of.

On their turn, each player uses the cards in their hands to make the best scoring word possible by laying them on top of the cards placed in the middle. Scores their turn, then draws from the draw pile to make up for the cards they just played. The next player then plays their cards on top of the cards the previous player just played creating a new word and also new community cards. Each time a player plays the community cards and the players cards change, creating a constant change to the game every turn. Game play continues until all the cards are gone from the draw pile. The highest scorer wins.

Bonus cards include double word points, skips, wilds, and switches.

184511.name: Dark Coast
184511.description:
Dark Coast - A Fantasy Role-Playing Game

From the preface:

"Dark Coast" is a set of rules for a Fantasy role-playing game (RPG) in a heroic setting.

User summary:

The game book has very high production quality. Characters are defined by a process that attempts to emphasize character development over statistics generation. First, players define a cultural background which includes race. Next, the player selects one or more quirks, which generally are handicaps. Players determine past experience by spending a pool of points. Then characters generate statistics, add possessions, and begin the game. Attributes include Brawn, Dexterity, Agility, Perception, Spirit, and Reason. Each Attribute is divided into six areas, or skills. For example, Perception includes Reaction, Alertness, Missile Combat, Tracking, Searching, and Arcane Magic.

Action resolution is dependent upon the type of action being attempted--they are categorized as either Trivial, Minor, or Major. Trivial or Minor actions are typically resolved narrative action and with playing cards, respectively. In general, to resolve major actions a Talent Level is derived from Talent and Flairs (as applicable). A Challenge Level is determined from the action description. The Talent Level and the Challenge Level are added together and increased by one; a pool of D6 equal to this score is rolled and several of the lowest and highest are removed until one remains; the remaining die is the result. Challenge Level removals come from the highest scores; Talent Level removals come from the lowest scores. Rolls of 1-3 fail, while 4-6 succeed. The mechanism for removing dice from the high and low ends means that middle results (basic failure or basic success) are far more likely than miserable failure or superior success.

For example, for an action with a Talent Level of 3 and a Challenge Level of 4, a player would roll 3+4+1 d6, then discard the 3 lowest results, then discard the 4 highest results, then take the remaining result and use it as the outcome.

Characters gain Experience Points and then spend them to increase Talents. The book also contains a chapter on Actions, Equipment, Adventuring, Magic, Monsters, and Economy. The final chapter of the book, The Grey Age, gives an overview of a heroic fantasy setting--it is not developed enough for "out of the box" use.

184512.name: Screw: A Sexual Game of Who Done It?
184512.description:
A Sexual Game of Who done it?

As an adult, how often do you actually have to piece together the details of a murder? In this revamped version of the classic game Clue, instead of solving a mysterious murder, players must piece together the details of the previous night's drunken activities. Did you screw Miss Scarlett with a condom on in the utility closet? Perhaps, after he called you a failure, you hit Professor Plum with a desk lamp in the library. Maybe you pleasured Miss Peacock with your finger in her ass. Have fun with your friends trying to sort out the twisted details because, chances are, you'll really have to solve these kinds of mysteries soon, you big party animal, you.

184513.description:
Munchkin Edycja Rozszerzona which means Munchkin Extended Edition is a Polish version that contains Munchkin and Fairy Dust expansion. Other than that nothing was changed.

Go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

Admit it. You love it.

This award-winning card game, designed by Steve Jackson, captures the essence of the dungeon experience... with none of that stupid roleplaying stuff. You and your friends compete to kill monsters and grab magic items. And what magic items! Don the Horny Helmet and the Boots of Butt-Kicking. Wield the Staff of Napalm... or maybe the Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment. Start by slaughtering the Potted Plant and the Drooling Slime, and work your way up to the Plutonium Dragon...

And it's illustrated by John Kovalic! Fast-playing and silly, Munchkin can reduce any roleplaying group to hysteria. And, while they're laughing, you can steal their stuff.
184513.name: Munchkin Edycja Rozszerzona

184514.name: Blue Moon

videogamehonor.36304: 2016 Emotional Games Best Game Design Nominee

184514.description:
User summary

An atmospheric game, where the object of the game is to enjoy the scenery. The player simply walks through a 2D nightly environment. Stopping at certain spots might activate a certain event, which might or might not affect the rest of the game.
One walkthrough takes roughly 5 minutes, but finding all possible endings and events will take a lot of experimenting.

184515.name: Das grosse Suisse Mania Spiel
184515.description: In Suisse Mania you are ballooning over Switzerland and its 26 cantons. During your travel you learn a lot of interesting but also quaint things.

184516.description:
This is the part#1 of the stretch goals unlocked thanks to the KS Campaign. It contains :

One new character meeple called The Political Activist 22mm with one sheet of rules
2 Official Variants :
The peaceful mayor : He can collect votes instead of blocking the building.
The parks : The parks are now eligible to be upgraded. Parks level 2 and 3 can not be built anymore though.

One Standardization chart numerated and signed by the designer Alban Viard that explains the relation between the tiles, the money, the Vote points, the pollution and the mini-meeples.
184516.name: Small City: Character Meeple Expansion 1 – The Political Activist

184517.description:
This is the part #2 of the Stretch goals unlocked thanks to the KS campaign.
It contains :

4 New player boards called the Beach printed both side (Easy and Expert). The Beach now counts as a giant Cultural Building and helps the development of the Residences.
One sheet of rules
184517.name: Small City: Player boards Expansion #1 – The Beach

184518.description:
A Decktet game in which you are a trader in the land of Aucteraden taking goods from market to the different clans within the province. Your object is to acquire goods at a fair price to create trade routes. You must be frugal and plan your routes well to amass your wealth and expand your influence.

In this solitaire game you take cards from a draw, or market area at the top of the playing board. Chips can be spent to draw certain cards to place in a tableau. Scoring consists of ascending/descending sequences of cards (1, 2, 4, 5). At the end of the game each suit's longest sequence is tallied for a final score. If this score is greater than or equal to 40 then you have won the game.
184518.name: Aucteraden

184519.description:
Playing as researchers on a quest for exotic specimens, Dart through the Amazon leads you through the world's largest rain forest to collect colorful dart frogs for scientific study. Racing against your fellow researchers, this expedition is no simple task, for amidst the Amazon, danger lurks around every bend.

As a 2-4 player dart frog collecting game, Dart through the Amazon features two modes of play designed for both children and adults to enjoy!

The base mode which is played without special rules and abilities offers younger children the opportunity to play the game. We also recommend this mode for beginners who are first learning the game.

The advanced mode of play features Researcher Cards that have their own special abilities adding new twists throughout the game. This mode is enabled by selecting one of our five Researchers before the game begins: Duke, Koral, Samuel, Tobias & Domingo.
184519.name: Dart through the Amazon

184520.name: Fianco
184520.description:
Abstract 2 player game of moving your discs forward. The goal is to reach your opponent's baseline with one of your pieces before he succeeds in doing so on your side.
Think of checkers, but a different set-up. You're obliged to take an opponents' piece, but only one at a turn, no double hits. Plus it is only allowed to hit an opponents' piece forward, not backward. Control over the side-lines is important as your piece cannot be hit then. Fianco is Italian for "side" or "wing."

184521.name: Pop-Up Pirate! Treasure Island
184521.description: Roll the die, search for the correct key. Use your memory to remember where it was. Unlock the chest and don't disturb the pirate. First to six coins wins.

boardgamehonor.40505: 2016 Golden Geek Best Party Game Nominee

184522.description:
Stay alive, gain a fortune...

Dead Last — originally known as Tontine — is a "social collusion" game of shifting alliances, betrayals, and murder for profit in which players must conspire and vote upon whom to kill each round. Any means of overt or covert communication is allowed — a glance, a nod, pointing under the table, flashing a card, anything – but make sure you don't tip off the target or they could ambush you instead! In the end, one or two players will remain, either claiming all the gold or squaring off in a final showdown before starting the next round of play. The first player to score 24 points of gold wins.

Thematically, the inspiration for the game is one of the oldest pulp fiction/detective novel tropes: the Tontine, a financial investment that accrues, but pays out only to the last surviving member of the group. This practice is now largely illegal as it famously had the tendency to lead to murder.

But it is the subtle art of communication that delivers the fun of the game and you conspire with each other. If you are the target of the most votes, you're dead, and if you did not side with the popular vote, you are also dead, so you constantly have to stay informed or deceive your target to band together without letting the target know. Wink, smile, kill — that's the whole game. As soon as someone asks, "Hey, wanna play Dead Last?", the game has already begun — and if you don't know who the target is, it very well could be you...
184522.name: Dead Last

184523.description:
Sealed Despatches, an extension to the Admiral's Order versions Edition 74 or All Hands!, pays even more attention to enabling a historically correct simulation. In particular the historically accurate differences in the armament of the ships are covered very precisely. While still keeping the rules as simple as possible, it simulates the effect of these differences in a way that requires the player consider them for each individual ship. This should result in a more authentic set of tactics, which are chosen when commanding a fleet.

While Admiral’s Order with its original rules is an interesting tactical and relatively realistic game, Sealed Despatches now provides an even more accurate simulation of the weapon technology of the time.
184523.name: Admiral's Order: Sealed Despatches

164855.name: Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail – All Hands!

184524.description:
1867 is an expansion to 1861: Railways of the Russian Empire, set in Canada. It is essentially "1861 on a new map." The map represents the central part of Canada, consisting of the southern part of the provinces of Ontario and Quebec.

The key new features are:
a) There are no fixed positions for the minor companies, you choose a start position when you put up a minor for auction.
b) The State Railway doesn't run its trains and save up for another, but rather just takes the next new train each round. This speeds up the game a little in comparison to 1861, and also accelerates the trains somewhat.

In 2017, this expansion has been released as a full game: 1867: The Railways of Canada.
184524.name: 1867: The Railways of Canada

23817.name: 1861: The Railways of the Russian Empire

184525.name: Obama Llama
184525.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to the rhyming game with the funny sounding name! Obama Llama is full of weird and wonderful rhymes. You'll come across Cara Delevingne on a washing machine, George Clooney doing a moony, and Harrison Ford swallowing a sword. Your job is to describe or mime these rhymes, with your team shouting out as many as they can in 30 seconds time.

Obama Llama was first released in 2015 in the UK and has been rereleased in 2016 in a U.S. edition that features a different front cover and more U.S.-tailored game content.

184526.name: Der unsichtbare Mord
184526.description:
user summary

This quickstart for Private Eye contains a bare-bones rules summary and a short scenario (Der unsichtbare Mord). It was created for the German Gratisrollenspieltag 2014 (Free RPG Day).

184527.name: Die Erbschaft
184527.description:
user summary

This quickstart for Private Eye contains a bare-bones rules summary and a short scenario (Die Erbschaft). It was created for the German Gratisrollenspieltag 2015 (Free RPG Day).

184528.name: The Art of Bidding
184528.description:
In The Art of Bidding, you are a gallery owner trying to increase the Prestige of your business. Buy and sell paintings by Jackson Pollock, Vincent Van Gogh, Johannes Vermeer, Eugene Delacroix, and Andrei Rublev and become the most Prestigious gallery owner.

In game play, players own three paintings by one of the greatest painters of all time. Each player will auction their own paintings (one of which is a fake) and try to acquire paintings of other masters throughout gameplay. During bidding, players may bid with all assets at their disposal and the player auctioning a painting may accept the best offer and does not have to simply accept the highest monetary offer. Players also can draw Gallery cards that may give investment dividends or may be used as end game multipliers of Prestige points.

184529.name: Politair
184529.description:
There are 37 holes and ecah player has 18 pieces. Everybody places their pieces on the board so that only one hole is free.

Each player tries to take out more pieces than his opponent.

To take out one of his pieces he has to jump over one of his pieces provided there is an open hole on the other side. He can jump over an opponents piece but without taking it out.

At the end of the game the player with less pieces wins!

184530.description:
Qwixx: Big Points is an expansion for Qwixx that consists of two 80-page scorepads that provide a new way to score big points.

Each scoresheet adds two new rows to the four rows on the original scoresheet: a red/yellow row between the red and yellow rows and a green/blue row between the green and blue rows. While playing the game, if you've crossed out, say, the red 5 and you're presented with a red 5 later in the game (whether through your roll or an opponent's roll), you can cross out the red/yellow 5.

As in the original game, you can't cross out a number to the left of a crossed-out number, so once you've crossed out the red/yellow 5, you can't cross out the red/yellow 2, 3 or 4.

The game still ends when a second row has been completed or when one player has failed to cross off anything for the fourth time. Players then score their four single-colored rows, with the Xs in the dual-colored rows adding to the total number of Xs in both of those colored rows. Whoever has the highest score wins!
184530.name: Qwixx: Big Points

184531.name: Monsters Macabre
184531.description:
From the back of the book:

MONSTERS MACABRE adds many new things to haunt the night in your CRYPTWORLD game! Comprehensive guidelines are provided to help CMs create their own new horrors. New rules provide the option of playing monster PCs, for those players up to the challenge!

Add additional terrors to your CRYPTWORLD game! This book contains:


71 new Things
Guidelines for creating your own Things
10 new unsettling powers
Rules for monster PCs
Optional rules for variable weapon damage
Tables for generating random monster hunting organizations
A complete adventure

184533.name: Eco Town
184533.description:
Build your own town! Complete your very own town with houses, trees, bicycle, recycle bin and rain water tank. The town on each playing board can be joined together in many different ways for more creative play! The perfect dice game for the little ones to learn to save our environment.

Setting up:
1. Each Player takes a board
2. Put all the playing pieces in the center

To Play:
1. Roll the dice
2. Pick up the item that is the same color as the dice and place it on the spot on the gameboard with the corresponding color.
3. Next Player roll the dice
4. If the player rolls a same color as he previously got, he has to place the item at the next player's gameboard.

Winning:
The winner is the first player with all pieces in correct colors and positions, thus completed building an EcoTown!

184534.name: The Alex Morgan Board Game!
184534.description: The Alex Morgan Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Alex Morgan by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of American women's soccer star Alex Morgan. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Morgan's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. The first player to reach the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

184536.description:
When shape shifters do battle they do with displays of their skills and strength. The shifter who best adapts to the tactics of their opponents is the victor.

Set Up
Each play gets one set of the four Form Cards. Unused Form Cards are set aside.

The Combat Style Cards are shuffled and dealt out until each player has an equal number. Un-dealt cards are set aside face down.

Objective
Be the first player to empty your hand of Combat Style Cards.

Play
Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning
The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.
184536.name: Transmogrification

boardgameimplementation.29793: ATS: Axis Legion – Spanish Division Azul on the Eastern Front

184537.description:
Using the Advanced Tobruk System, this installment depicts the efforts of the 250th Infantry "Blue" Division, made up of Spaniards sympathetic to the Nazi cause. Specifically, the scenarios here deal with small-unit actions around the area of the Volkhov River in northwest Russia.

From the website... Spanish Blue Division is an Eastern Front-themed historical module for ATS that completly re-vamps that which came before. Maps, new, counters, new, changes, yes, color 3-hole rules, yes Nothing held over from before, and uses WINTERIZED MAPS!
184537.name: ATS Spanish Blue Division: Eastern Front 1941

184538.description:
From the publisher's website:

As the morning of 27th May dawned the 8th Panzer Regiment under Lieutenant Teege led Rommel’s wide sweep around the British southern flank at Bir Hacheim. With one hundred and eighty tanks, the regiment was arrayed in spearhead formation with the first section moving forward on a wide front of one and one half miles by about a mile deep. At about 0715 hours, the call rang out in the headsets, “Enemy armor, twelve o’clock!” A British lieutenant of the 8th Hussars also dryly noted enemy armor to his regimental HQ by radio. “It looks as if Jerry’s come with a Panzer brigade,” only to correct himself moments later. “There’s more than a brigade, its the whole bloody Afrika Korps. Alert! Alert!”

And thus began the historic Battle of Gazala. It was May of 1942, Hitler’s armies were still the masters of Europe, with more conquests to come. And yet YOU, tactical-level gamer and ATS devotee ... has only experienced this battle in ‘penny packets’, a tank here, two tanks there. Until NOW. Because the ATS GAZALA MONSTER is here to rescue you from never being able to cross off, ‘big, real Western Desert warfare experience’ ... from your bucket list. Imagine the old Tobruk orders-of-battle ... with all of their one-to-one representations ... then knife forward with your formations of 10, no 15, wait add in Troop Leaders and panzer leaders ... and make that 17 AFVs ... in a full-blown presentation that gives you ALL of the tanks, guns and men (i.e., all combat counters; just bring your ATS rulebook and markers) ... and the playing area to duke it out in.

The set also debuts the first collection of 11” × 16” folding DESERT GEO boards and a selection of overlays to go with them.
184538.name: ATS Gazala Monster

184539.name: It's Nothing Personal
184539.description:
It’s Nothing Personal is your basic race-to-the finish game – assuming your definition of “basic” involves harpooning the other racers in the legs so you can gain the lead. Friends become enemies and enemies become bigger enemies as you race along your own individual tracks from the starting space to the finish line.

Here’s how it breaks down:

1. Roll the die and move forward that number of spaces
2. Decision time! You could:
a. Move yourself forward a few more spaces.
b. Move another player back a few spaces.
c. Place an obstacle on an opponent’s track
d. Place a benefit on your own track
e. Draw one of 60 mildly zany chance cards and let fate be the boss of you.
3. After each round of turns, there’s a non-secret vote to determine who should move back several spaces. Now’s your chance to convince the others to gang up on the player who’s winning, the player who wronged you last turn, or the player who just doesn't share your opinion about the 1973 NBA All-Star Game.
4. Repeat. Exact revenge as needed.

184540.name: Empires of Tal
184540.description: Empires of Tal is a set of miniatures rules for 10mm miniatures set in a fantasy setting but can easily support historic battles in the same scale. Empires of Tal has an extensive library of in game spells, monsters, equipment and special units for use.

184541.name: Darker Days Rulebook
184541.description:
User summary:

Character's have six Attributes, rated 1-5: Strength, Dexterity, Perception, Intelligence, Technical, and Operation. Attributes are purchased from an initial pool. Each Attribute supports a set of specific Skills. Skill Levels start at the base Attribute rating and increase from there.

Skill use is resolved by rolling 2d6 and adding the appropriate Skill level. A basic success target of 12 is used, though this may be modified by the difficulty of the action. Combat uses the same Skill resolution system, with the success target raised by the opponent's dodge skill. Damage varies by weapon but in any case is reduced by the opponent's body resistance Skill and any armor. Sustained damage may be either stun damage or hit damage (mental and physical, respectively). Taking full stun value causes a character to fall unconscious; taking full hit value causes a character to collapse and start bleeding to death.

Rules for computers, vehicles, experience, and psionics (omnipresent) also are offered. The rules in a slightly shortened version also are offered in DOC (MS Word '97) format, comprising four files--"Shortened Rules" (10 pages), "Skills" (3 pages), "Contacts" (1 page), and "Character Sheet" (2 pages).

184542.name: Darker Days Equipment Catalog
184542.description:
From the introduction:

Technology is everything at 2031. Almost all technological fields have advanced but the science of Cybertechnology has made the greatest leap. Imbedding steel in the human body is common practice these days--starting from the all too common DNI jack and ending with Mercs cybernized to their teeth.

User summary:

The equipment catalog is divided into four main areas--the introduction, Cyberware, Weapons, and General Equipment. Cyberware entries have a name, a "Humanity" cost, a dollar cost, and a description. Weapons have a name, an associated skill, and details about fire/damage/range/ammo, a dollar cost, and a description. General equipment has a category, a name, a dollar cost, and a description.

The equipment catalog also is available as a file download consisting of two DOC (Word '97) files: "Equipment" and "Equipment Detail". The two files must be used together.

184543.name: Darker Days: The World of 2031
184543.description:
From the Introduction:

Imagine a world roughly three decades into the future. Technology has advanced far beyond its boundaries and is now imbedded into the human flesh and mind. The providers of this technology, the megacorporations, are controlling everything, including the humans who crave for their merchandise. The government has no real power in this technological world, for they provide nothing of interest to the population. Most cities have combined into large sprawls - giant filthy monsters of stone and steel providing a home for humanity. Crime rates are higher then ever - drug addicts crawl the sprawl's sewers while cybernized gang members roam the streets.

User summary:

The World of 2031 provides the setting for the Darker Days roleplaying game. It is presented in five main sections: an introduction, "A Brief History", "The Mercs", "The 2031 Society", and "Corporations".

184544.name: Darker Days GM Section
184544.description:
User summary:

GM Section contains information about the campaign and game that is for the GM only. The section includes a campaign timeline that pivots around a critical date when an event occurs that "enables" or "creates" psionics.

The GM Section is presented in the following major entries: introduction, "Psionics at 2031", "June 13th, 2031 - The Day of Chaos", "The Swifter Project", "An Interview with Dr. Kirshov", and "Dr. Kirshov's Personal Notes".


Spoiler Alert



On the day in question, a permanent gateway between the campaign's physical world and the Negative Energy Plane was created as a result of an experimental accident. The three major effects of the conjoining include the Bad Luck Effect, Psionics, and a significant malevolent presence on the threshold.

184545.name: 13 Sentinels: Aegis Rim
184545.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




An RPG featuring mecha which explores the themes of rising despair and the psssage of everyday life following a destructive catastrophe.

Source: The Game Website.

184546.name: Darklands
184546.description:
User summary:

Darklands billed itself as an RPG, and there was clear intent to develop a rules system, but when development stopped (about 2003) the final state product was a system agnostic setting. In most respects the world of Darklands aligns with traditional cyberpunk--the world is a bleak place rules by mega-corporations; the poor are left to fend for themselves; pop culture consumes the attention of the average masses. What makes the setting unique is the concept of the Warbreed--ancient creatures directly created by ancient gods, left behind on earth in ancient times. But now, the Warbreed have aligned with earth to fight against those same ancient gods. The campaign primarily is based in Gothica, a brooding mega-sprawl that sits about where present day New York City is located.

In the rudimentary "game rules" as presented character creation appears to have been race, class, and level based with attributes purchased using a point pool.

In the early versions the game was released in DOC format. The final version of the game (v0.71), as released, exists only in HTML. In addition, a web-based extension was contemplated.

184547.name: Darktime
184547.description:
User summary:

Darktime is a (very) minimal setting providing a (very) basic Cyberpunk background for the FUDGE roleplaying system. The setting is presented in seven main sections: "The story", "How to start", "Guide to the city", "Enemies", "Character sheets", "Scenarios", and "Credits".

Several of these sections are quite brief--for example, "The story" merely sets the scene as the year 3050 in New York City where a cyberpunk atmosphere exists; "Character sheets" refers the reader to the FUDGE rules. "How to start" is a very basic and generic introduction to roleplaying. "Guide to the city" provides the bulk of the setting, but is quite short. "Scenarios" would better be titled "Adventure hooks" as no actual scenarios are presented.

184548.name: State the Picture
184548.description:
Description from the publisher:

State the Picture encourages children (and adults) to learn about the fifty U.S. states through a family-friendly drawing charades game. Players move across the board by correctly guessing the names of states based on their fellow players' corresponding, hand-drawn clues.

184549.description:
From the publisher's website:

ATS MAXIM GORKI is from prolific designer Mark 'Tank' Porterfield. Mark brought you the fruits of his massive military library and penchant for research with Panther Line + Berlin 1 and Berlin 2 (not to mention the Monster Berlin versions), all set on World War II's Eastern Front. Before that, almost 20 years ago Tank brought you Pointe du Hoc, with a healthy on-site assist from Steve and Rob Pleva, plus map work (and on site research too) by Phil Nobo. The TANK is back and this time he is modeling another uniiqe Festung, the Sevastopol bastion of Stalin's Soviet Union and this is a MONSTER MODULE to do his work justice.

Some of the interesting details you'll receive: Russian Naval Infantry, German demolition AFVs including Kettenkrad and Bren Carrier Demo vehicles; massive Naval Gun Turrets; Concrete Trenches; German Engineers, Fortress rules; and so much more. Plus a large map with healthy-sized hexes, more terrain variants, all using official ATS nomenclature for the SSRs while avoiding 5 point type and eye-watering verbiage bloat in what will be the largest Engineer-operation ever gamed at this scale.
184549.name: ATS Maxim Gorki II: The Siege of Sevastopol 1942

184552.description:
From the publisher's website:

Early on the morning of 11 December 1941 the garrison of Wake Island, with the support of the four remaining Wildcats, repelled the first Japanese landing attempt by the South Seas Force, which included the light cruisers Yubari, Tenryu, and Tatsuta; the destroyers Yayoi, Mutsuki, Kisaragi, Hayate, Oite, and Asanagi; two Momi-class destroyers converted to patrol boats (Patrol Boat No. 32 and Patrol Boat No. 33), and two troop transport ships containing 450 Special Naval Landing Force troops. This encounter began the battle that is both famous beyond fame and depicted in ATS WAKE: GALLANT STAND.

You get a stirring map of the embattled atoll, plus all the combat counters you need to play, are included in this substantial module. Marines in early war uniforms, Japanese naval troops, new aircraft, rafts, and patrol boats. Also included are color, 3-hole punched rules and notes, and all scenarios in color format.

But this module means so much more! It has never been gamed at this scale and is not planned to be. Strike that! It IS HERE and you can nail it NOW. The counter collection provides ALL of the combat counters you need to play and is a diverse and colorful collection with new art including those Japanese naval troops, also construction worker volunteers, naval personnal ... just bring your ATS Rulebook 2014 and markers and get your hands on a good book about the battle. Then lay out the looong island map (it will fit on a standard six foot gaming table ... and when you hover above that map, covered in counters .... we think you will enjoy the spectacle!)
184552.name: ATS Wake: Pacific Alamo

184553.name: Dead Meat: Ultima Carneficina Dello Zombie!

rpg.28327: Dead Meat: Ultima Carneficina Dello Zombie!

184553.description:
Dead Meat: Ultima Carneficina Dello Zombie!

User summary:

Each player will generate a set of Attributes, of which there are three in the game: ZIP, WHOMP, and GUTS. Attributes gain a numeric rating from a pool of 7 points. Each number represents a d6, giving a player three dice pools in the various Attributes. Each player will next generate three characters called Personas. These Personas will all use (re-use) the same Attributes block. The Personas should match the various roles the GM has allocated for the campaign--remember, the goal is to replicate a zombie movie plot and the GM will thus determine which people in the movie will be represented by the players' Personas.

The action resolution mechanic involves determining which Attribute will determine success in a given situation. ZIP indicates reaction time, running, dodging, and fast acting. WHOMP indicates combat ability and tasks that require only raw muscle. GUTS is how likely you are to avoid freezing in fear, and how resistant you are to the zombie plague. In combat, characters will use their WHOMP Attribute and roll a pool of dice equal to that attribute's rating. Rolls of 5 and 6 indicate success--if the total of success rolls equals or exceeds the zombie's GUTS roll then the character has damaged the zombie. Characters can disperse their WHOMP dice pool into multiple attacks. Characters must state on every attack they are aiming for the head or they are assumed to be making a body shot, which is ineffective even if successful.

Characters who are wounded make a GUTS roll to determine if they can continue to the end of the scene (failure means they don't) when they make another GUTS roll to avoid a permanent loss of GUTS and possible undeath. Zombies have the same Attributes as characters except CHUNKS replaces GUTS--functionally, they are about the same.

Weapons are of several types: Sorta Wimpy, Medium, Large, and Wicked. They do progressively more damage. The rules also include pre-generated zombies of several types (Basic Undead Geek, Lunger, Knight-Hunting Demon from the Crypt, Cyborg, and King Daddy Demon). The rules conclude with a list of recommended zombie movies.

184554.name: ATS Great War: Tankschreken!
184554.description:
From the publisher's website:

Legendary designer Ian Daglish (dec.) left behind his take on the Great War for tactical-level gamers and the baton has crossed the finish line in the form of ATS GREAT WAR I: Tankschreken!
The module includes all the combat counters needed to play plus 10 scenarios, all featuring British vs. German actions ... and of course some of them debut tanks ... the name deriving from an attempt to keep this new technology secret by making the enemy think ‘water tanks’ were being constructed. You also receive—as a SPECIAL BONUS—ALL OF THE BOARDS NEEDED TO PLAY in 11” × 16” folding format. You also receive a Play Aid to augment standard system play aid cards.

You receive all the combat counters you need to play. Special rules in color, 3-hole format. And of course, a collection of color format scenarios (8 in all) that all feature German/British combat.

184555.name: ATS Great War: Blasted Woods – French vs. German Scenarios!
184555.description:
From the publisher's website:

Prior to his unexpected passing designer and author Ian Daglish (dec.) sent in his GWASL module materials, joining the work of other CH designers in the effort to bring another era of warfare to the collection. Losing top men is sad, and they can never, ever be replaced.

But their contributions, like authors of yore, can speak to us, and we are grateful to have this chance to make the Great War return for an encore ... on your gaming table in the form of ATS GREAT WAR MODULE II. It is all very straightforward, and the Special Rules give you the handbook you need to maneuver the men and machines, some representing combat systems never seen before, but prominent since. The Chauchet LMG, new French soldiers, Attack a' Outrance rules and couinters, French tanks and Guns, and more!

You receive all the combat counters you need to play. Special rules in color, 3-hole format. And of course, a collection of color format scenarios (8 in all) that all feature German/French combat.

184556.description:
This little set includes everything you need to play an introductory Panzer Grenadier scenario: the rules and charts (in downloadable form), a scenario card, a set of 40 superb laser-cut, mounted real playing pieces, and an 11x17-inch real full-color map on heavy cardstock.

The pieces, map and scenario are drawn from Panzer Grenadier: Burning Tigers.

Comes packaged in 9"x12" ziplock bag.
184556.name: Panzer Grenadier: Special Free Set

184557.name: A Cha Co
184557.description:
In A Cha Co, you become a pyrotechnician wanting to be the first to construct 10 fireworks to win the game!

Roll the dice (number is dependent upon the amount of players, n+1 formula). You choose the colour of highest quantity rolled. Then, everyone hides a gem of the colour of firework they wish to produce, with a simultaneous reveal afterward. Those who have chosen a singular colour (that no one else has selected) each receive a ring of that colour, representing one firework.

The point value system is the following:

White = 1 point
Blue = 2 points
Red = 5 points

The steps are repeated until a player reaches 10 points first and wins the game!

184558.name: Extreme Earth (SUPERS!)

rpgsetting.28550: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting

184558.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:
• An introduction to the exciting world of EXTREME EARTH complete with a historical timeline and summary of the current state of affairs
• Super Talents: the superpowers of EXTREME EARTH
• Rules for creating your own EXTREME EARTH Super Talented characters using SUPERS! (sold separately)
• A detailed look at the inner workings of FIST: the Department of Federal Investigations into Super Talents
• Suggestions for running your own EXTREME EARTH campaign and adventures
• Background information on FIST's most dangerous enemies including MANTIS and the Pantheon
• An introductory EXTREME EARTH adventure: Merchants of War

Enter a world of corporate greed, government corruption, limited natural resources, and endless warfare where anyone possessing Super Talents becomes a pawn of the Powers That Be. Join the ranks of EXTREME EARTH fans today!

211877.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 1 World War 2 Era

boardgameintegration.193024: Lock 'n Load Tactical World War II Era Core Rules

184559.description:
In May of 1940, the Germans launched Fall Gelb (Case Yellow). Scores of German divisions flooded through the Ardennes and across the borders of France, Belgium and Holland. The blitzkrieg tactics first used in Poland, in 1939, had been put into action again—and perfected. For over six weeks the Allies, including the British Expeditionary Force (BEF), put up a staunch defense. Despite their defiance, they could not withstand the fierce onslaught of the German Wehrmacht, the fearless Fallschirmjägers and the notorious SS.

Heroes in Defiance depicts the full range of the battles for France and the Low Countries, from the first Fallschirmjäger airborne assaults in Holland to the closing of the pocket of the BEF and the remnants of the French Army at the Channel ports. The module combines all the scenarios and components from Heroes of the Blitzkrieg and its expansion, In Defeat, Defiance, into a new and updated complete game in the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series. Heroes in Defiance also adds five new scenarios (two previously unpublished) and eliminates the need for overlays with additional maps. It’s the blitzkrieg of 1940 at its best!
184559.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes in Defiance

211942.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

boardgamecompilation.20596: Lock 'n Load: A Ring of Hills

boardgameintegration.193531: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules

184560.description:
The Expansion Module A Ring of Hills is now back in print as a COMPLETE GAME!

Heroes of the Falklands brings you to the windswept, rocky landscape of the Falkland Islands—or Islas Malvinas, as they are known by the Argentines. The brief but brutal war in 1982 began after the Argentines unexpectedly seized Stanley, the capital of the Falklands, and the island of South Georgia from small garrisons of British Royal Marines. The British government responded by sending a large naval task force to the South Atlantic to reclaim the disputed islands. Here, the fierce ground combat that occurred during the war is depicted as only the immersive squad-level Lock ’n Load Tactical Series can.

The 13 scenarios Heroes of the Falklands feature the Argentine seizures of Stanley and South Georgia and all of the major land battles, from the British Paras’ costly but morale-boosting assaults on Darwin Hill and Goose Green, to the daring commando raid on Top Malo House, across East Falkland to the climatic battles for the ring of hills around Stanley. Two what-if scenarios depict Argentine opposition to the British landing at San Carlos and a last-ditch fight for control of Stanley. Put on your cold-weather combat gear and bring along a pair of night-vision goggles: the fate of the islands is at stake!

It's not just squad combat it's Lock 'n Load Tactical
184560.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Falklands

34085.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha

boardgameintegration.193531: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules

184561.description:
It’s time for another tour of duty. The award-winning Lock ’n Load Tactical Series. Heroes of the Nam. This squad-level game, with its fast-paced, intense impulse system, drops you right into the middle of furious jungle firefights and all-out, building-to-building assaults.

In Heroes of the Nam, forces from the Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN), the United States Army and Marines, as well as their valiant Anzac allies from Australia and New Zealand, take on determined enemies from the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) and the unpredictable Viet Cong (VC). Powerfully armed Squads are at the vanguard of all actions, spurred on by daring Leaders and other unique individuals such as Snipers, Medics, Corpsmen, Chaplains, Advisors and, of course, Heroes, whose unique skills and sudden appearance can alter the tide of any battle. Helicopters, tanks and armored-personnel carriers (APCs) also join the fight. Test your mettle in over 25 action-packed scenarios. Only the heroic will be victorious.

- - - - - -

Heroes of Nam is essentially a component and rules upddate of Forgotten Heroes and ANZAC Attack (both previously published by Shrapnel Games and later Lock n Load Games).
184561.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Nam

184562.name: Was ist Was TV: Das Quizspiel zur TV/-Serie
184562.description:
Google translation:

Together we are unbeatable! We know everything! Yup! You do not believe that? You want to try it really, to beat us? Well, then you sit down times!

The trivia game for the TV series is based on the facts of the popular WAW-IST WAS books. Theo, Tess and Quentin present interesting facts and exciting from six different topic areas.

The choices are; Ancient Rome, whales & dolphins, volcanoes, Planet & Space, Cars and Ritter. On the basis of 198 questions per topic, players can prove that they are attentive and well rested to go through the world. And while playing you can also learn a lot.

In the game it comes to answering questions correctly and thereby collect chips. Anyone who has ever Theo, Tess and Quentin completely, it can be exchanged for a three WAS IST WAS / point. And who has the most points at the end wins the game.

Content:
6 card sets of 32 sheet
3 fixtures printed on both sides
1 tableau cards with WAS IST WAS chips
1 character
1 set of instructions


From the Backside (German)
Zusammen sind wir unschlagbar! Wir wissen alles! Jawohl! Ihr glaubt das nicht? Ihr wollt es wirklich probieren, uns zu schlagen? Also gut, dann setzt euch mal hin!

Das Quiz-Spiel zur TV-Serie basiert auf den Fakten aus den beliebten WAW-IST-WAS-Büchern. Theo, Tess und Quentin präsentieren Interessantes, Wissenswertes und Spannendes aus sechs verschiedenen Themengebieten.

Zur Auswahl stehen; Das alte Rom, Wale & Delphine, Vulkane, Planeten & Raumfahrt, Autos und Ritter. Anhand von 198 Fragen pro Themengebiet können die Spieler beweisen, dass sie aufmerksam und ausgeschlafen durch die Welt gehen. Und beim Spielen kann man natürlich auch viel dazulernen.

Im Spiel geht es darum, Fragen richtig zu beantworten und dadurch Chips zu sammeln. Wer einmal Theo, Tess und Quentin komplett hat, kann diese drei gegen einen WAS-IST-WAS/Punkt eintauschen. Und wer am Schluß die meisten Punkte gesammelt hat, gewinnt das Spiel.

Inhalt:
6 Kartensätze zu je 32 Blatt
3 Spielpläne doppelseitig bedruckt
1 Kartentableau mit WAS-IST-WAS-Chips
1 Spilfigur
1 Spielanleitung

34085.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha

boardgameintegration.193024: Lock 'n Load Tactical World War II Era Core Rules

184563.description:
The Lock ’n Load Tactical Series advances into World War II’s Eastern Front with Heroes of the Motherland. The fate of the Soviet Rodina is at stake in 12 scenarios depicting ferocious battles across the Russian steppe, in the ruins of Stalingrad, and in Partisan-infested woods. From infantry spurred on by Commissars to intrepid Guards and stoic Partisans, the Soviets are poised for anything the German Wehrmacht and SS throw at them. It’s soldier against soldier and tank against tank. No matter the forces or the setting, the Soviets are poised to defend their homeland to the end.

Heroes of the Motherland is a complete module, utilizing all the scenarios from the expansion module Not One Step Back, and containing all necessary components from Band of Heroes and Swift & Bold, as well as new Maps that eliminate the need for overlays—that’s 14 Maps in all!
184563.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Motherland

211942.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

184564.description:
In March of 2011, Libyans in opposition to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi and his government took up arms. For eight months, the opposition, fighting under an interim governing body, the National Transitional Council (NTC), fought Colonel Gaddafi’s Loyalist forces all across the country. In October, during a fierce battle in the coastal city of Sirte, Gaddafi was captured and killed.

Days of Villainy is a expansion that can be played with ANY core/base games of the Lock 'n Load Tactical series. Days of Villainy depicts four of the fierce battles that occurred during the Libyan Civil War, including Colonel Gaddafi’s final epic confrontation. Both sides are loaded for bear, armed with RPG-7s and FN MAG and PKM machine guns. The Loyalists have the armored support of BTR-60s and T-55s, but the NTC rebels have plenty of well-armed Technicals to drive into battle, as well as KPV heavy machine guns and the aid of seasoned fighters from the Katiba Tiger and Al-Saiqa commando brigades.

Scenarios Include:

• Hold or Die: An armored column of Loyalist forces attempted to retake the vital oil hub of Marsa al-Brega, on the road to Benghazi. A tough fight was ahead of them, and the sun was setting.

• On the Road to Sirte: A convoy of NTC rebels and Al-Saiqa commandos tasked with delivering ammunition to Harawa was ambushed by a small force of Loyalists. Despite the initial blasts of roadside mines, the remnants of the convoy had to push through.

• Assault on Bab Al-Aziziya: In late August, NTC rebels entered Tripoli. Many neighborhoods were easily taken, but the Bab Al Aziziya compound, symbol of Gaddafi’s contemptible regime, was still intact. The compound had become a fortress that had to be taken.

• Game Over: On October 20th, 2011, an American Predator drone identified a Loyalist convoy leaving the city of pro-Gaddafi stronghold of Sirte. The drone and French aircraft in the area attacked the convoy, and NTC rebels in the sector closed in on the commotion. Little did they know that Gaddafi was a passenger in the convoy. The stage was set for a vicious, climatic battle.

Lock ʼn Load Tactical: Days of Villainy is an expansion that can be played with ANY complete Lock ʼn Load module.
184564.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Days of Villainy

boardgameintegration.193531: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules

184565.description:
For 10 years, from 1979 to 1989, the Soviet Union fought a bloody and, ultimately, unwinnable war in Afghanistan against the Mujahideen. It was a long, difficult war, and lessons were learned the hard way. The terrain and conditions were brutal. There were few, if any, stand-up fights. Ambushes, helicopter assaults, raids, and cordon-and-sweep were the necessary missions, the types of squad-level missions that are ideally suited to the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

The Bear & The Jackal (TB&TJ) contains nine fierce firefights from the Soviet-Afghan War. It expands Heroes of the Gap, and utilizes new counters of Mujahideen and Soviet forces, including Spetsnaz special-forces units; and it’s played on two plus-sized (approximately 9.5” x 16.5”) geomorphic maps. Grab an RPG-7 and find a rocky place to hide behind: there’s a Soviet convoy coming down the road!
184565.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Bear and the Jackal

184566.name: Liber Militum Tercios
184566.description:
From the publisher:

Liber Militum Tercios is a new historical wargame that will allow us to recreate the great battles of the Thirty Years’ War. The game was developed by El Kraken Released, team, and is edited by Design & Edits WxW Co.

There are 2 different versions of Tercios:
Liber Militum: The full version
Brevis Editio: Short Version, synthesized and free.

Portada-Brevis-EditioTercios is not intended for any specific miniatures scale. All rule design effort was put on allowing the player to adapt the game to any different model basing and scales.. However, we do recommend certain model sizes for units on the rules, but others could be used without compromising playability. Geometry dependence has been avoided as much as possible.

The number of miniatures that is necessary to represent a unit is subject to the sole discretion of the Army Collector, it is up to everyone to decide how many models will be enough to identify our troops. Even so, we suggest certain number in the rules, but just for guidance.

Tercios is a large scale wargame, since each unit in the game represents huge formations that often comprised more than a thousand men. This is why it is a game with more abstraction than others, because at this scale of war reenactment, individual soldier actions has no consecuences, it matters as a whole..

The gameplay is based upon orders execution, that are deployed at a planning phase. Command cards are used (there are 5 different cards), that are placed face down next to our units, and prepare our troops for different tasks: to run, to shoot, charge the enemy or resist stoically.

Units activation is alternated between players. The very command cards allow us to keep track of which units have been activated. The fact that the turns are not complete for a single player, but alternated between the two players, make the game a fluid dynamic experience. Once all the command cards have been executed, the turn will be finished and we will be ready to start a new one.

Cards also allow us to react, under certain circumstances, to enemy activity, what makes commands a complex tactical resource.. Deepening in the mastering of good decisions during the planning phase and managing the unexpected is a challenge for the player; reflective strategic fund is stimulated, what makes the experience very intuitive and agile..

Not knowing what cards your opponent has set and choosing the order of activation for your units, makes a very realistic simulation of the uncertainties of a real battle and delivers an increasing thrill, as the turns pass by..

As usual in wargames, actions are resolved by rolling dices. Tercios proposes a very simple system using six-sided dice; no need to do complex calculations, or having to learn a host of special rules. For a player with minimum experience (or without) it will be a matter of minutes to become familiar with the system.

184567.description:
Wasteland Justice is a tactical board game for 2-4 players. Players choose their drivers for their collection of vehicles and then race their opponents. Vehicles are outfitted with various modifications and deadly weapons all at the discretion of the player.

Players take turns to move their team of vehicles and engage their opponents until there is either one team left with at least one unwrecked vehicle or a player crosses the finish line. The winner being the first player to complete the course, alive, or be the “last team standing." There is no second place in this Wasteland.
184567.name: Wasteland Justice

184569.name: Lure of the Lost
184569.description:
From the introduction:

Lure of the Lost is an adventure for the Star Wars: Force and Destiny Beginner agme. It is designed to follow the events of Mountaintop Rescue, the Beginner Game’s included adventure.

During the events of Mountaintop Rescue, the Player Characters (PCs) rescued their mentor, Hethan Romund, and saved an ancient Jedi temple from Malefax, a dark side adept seeking its corruption. They may have managed to impress the Gatekeeper, an intelligence created by the Jedi to safeguard the temple’s secrets, although it is also possible that they have yet to earn his full respect. Regardless of the exact events of Mountaintop Rescue, the PCs have secured the temple from the forces of darkness, although much of it still remains locked to them. Now is the time for them to explore the temple and try to uncover its mysteries, while remaining alert for any further influence of the dark side.

184570.name: Absconding Zatwor
184570.description:
User Summary

This is a puzzle game in which you evade traps and use stealth to escape from room to room in a prison. The plotline is that you are a wrongfully convicted prisoner who must escape in order to prove your innocence. Traps vary from cameras and sound sensors to more complicated lasers. The game was criticized for being buggy when it first came out (which may be fixed by now) and for scaling badly to nearly impossible later levels.

184571.name: The Apotheosis Project
184571.description:
User Summary

You are two agents working to investigate crime and supernatural/alien plots. Like the X-Files, the agents are male and female, but unlike those agents, the two have special supernatural powers. Also you can alternate between the two of them to solve certain situations and use their best powers to navigate between Terran and alien worlds.

184572.name: Energy Balance
184572.description:
User Summary

This is an arithmetic puzzle in which you switch around numbers in a crossword style board to make the equations work out. Two equations answers are presented (confusedly separated by a division symbol) which are the current result and the desired result. This game is framed by dialogue between an alien and his cat as their spaceship breaks down, in a quirky give and take that resembles Katamari surrealism.

184578.description:
This first fan expansion from the HiG forums, is designed specifically for the Easter season.

Together with the Carcassonne Forum, "Fritz_Spinne" (Christof Struck) has thought up this fan expansion. It is about Easter eggs (chocolate eggs, or real eggs or whatever you like) to gather during the game. Of course you can eat them if you like, but it is advantageous at the end of the game to have the most eggs left.
184578.name: Carcassonne: Der Osterhase

184579.name: Time for the Bus
184579.description: Time for the Bus is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children shape an color recognition. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. In the game, each player places a school bus marker on a separate track leading to school. Each track is marked with one particular color and shape on each of its spaces. In turn, each player spins the spinner. The player whose color/shape is spun moves forward one space. The first player to reach the school wins. Along the way, players will land on "bus stop" spaces. Each time this happens, all players must sing "The Wheels on the Bus."

184580.name: Operation Escape E.V.I.L.
184580.description:
Four scientists from across the world have been invited by the Earth Vision Industrial Labs (E.V.I.L), to create a chemical potion that would eradicate malnutrition from our planet. However, after reaching the laboratory, the scientists realise that the E.V.I.L Chairman has other plans in mind and is looking to rule the world with a potent mind control potion. On refusing to cooperate, they were locked-up within the laboratory. Can you help them escape E.V.I.L?

The game basically involves moving on the board from one spot to another (based on die roll), each spot either gives you the option to buy some chemical, or steal money from prison guards. Essentially, you need to obtain all the resources needed for your eventual goal (decided at the start of the game), then move towards a location on the board, which is the warden's office and then die-roll your way out of a secret track to the end of the game. If you are the first one to do that, you win!

184581.name: Class Cleanup!
184581.description: Class Cleanup! is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children color recognition and the need to clean up their classroom. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. In the game, each player starts with a game piece and four tokens, each marked with a different object. All markers are placed on a start space with four separate tracks leading from it. Each track is marked with alternating red, yellow and blue spaces. In turn, each player spins the spinner, chooses a track, and moves to the next space on that track matching the color spun. When the player reaches the end of the track, he or she "puts away" the token matching the object show at the end of the track. On the player's next turn, he or she spins again and moves back toward the start by the same method. The first player to reach the end of all four tracks and put away all four objects wins.

184582.name: Team Time!
184582.description:
Team Time is an educational game designed to teach young children matching, counting and visual discrimination. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey.

Each player starts with a pile of matching coins or markers. The game board depicts a busy playground full of children.

On his or her turn, each player spins the spinner, which will point to a picture of a combination of colored pants, shirt and hat. The player must then find a child on the board with a matching outfit and mark the child with a marker. In order to make the game more difficult, a time limit can be set.

Players take turns spinning and marking children until all are marked. The player with the most marked children wins.

184584.name: Dead Weight
184584.description:
User Summary:

Characters in Dead Weight are survivors of a zombie apocalypse, living in a high density urban environment where they engage in "freerunning" (Parkour) to gather supplies and evade zombies. All characters are assumed to have some degree of skill in freerunning. The first half of the rules establish the setting. All survivors have banded into Tribes that live in the upper floors of skyscrapers. The more powerful the Tribe, the higher the floor they occupy. Lower floors are penetrated by zombies, upper floors become progressively safer the higher they are. Unfortunately for the survivors, all remaining supplies are found down at ground level, out in the urban sprawl. This necessitates frequent excursions of freerunning to allow survival. Most zobmies--most--are typical zombies. Some are worse. The goal of players is to keep their characters alive another day and hopefully gather some supplies in the process.

Characters have several Characteristics, including Grace, Virtues (Haste, Cunning, Passion), Tags (brief narrative descriptions), Glory, Doom, and Loot. Characters begin with three points of Grace, variable points in Virtues (an array of 2, 1, 0), a couple tags, and zero points in Glory, Doom, and Loot. No two characters can share the same distribution of Virtues.

Characters also belong to a Tribe (roughly analogous to an adventuring party in a traditional fantasy RPG). Tribes have several stats, including Height, Status, and Population. Height begins at one--not good, Status at zero, and Population at 50.

During the Day, the game proceeds as a narrative action largely among characters. Characters assume the narrative event by having a character embody one of their virtues. If more than one character wants the focus, a die mechanic selects a winner. Upon completing the narrative and returning home, dice are used to determine Loot points which contribute to Tribal Status, Population Growth, and Height.

During the Night, the GM controls the game using Doom dice which lead to zombie activity.

184585.name: Age of the Dead
184585.description:
User Summary:

Age of the Dead is a rules-light zombie-themed roleplaying game. The setting is somewhat atypical inasmuch as it occurs one year after a zombie plague has overcome the world. Characters survive in a world of zombies, depleted resources, and established power centers that vie for control.

Characters have Willpower (beginning with 10 Will Points); two Motivations (narrative tags); and three Skills (narrative tags). When characters encounter opposition (of any type, zombie or otherwise) the GM provides a Threat Rating (usually about 10) so the players can evaluate the situation. Players may use dice to attempt to reduce the Threat Rating; if the rating is reduced the player must provide a reasonable narrative rationale. Melee weapons are narrative elements that reduce the Threat Rating. Likewise, Vehicles are narrative elements that may reduce the Threat Rating, primarily by enabling rapid escape.

Because being wounded is fatal, characters do not sustain wounds. Instead, they sustain mental damage to their Willpower score. When Willpower is reduced to zero, the character reaches their Freakout Point which severely limits their options and likely leads to death-by-zombie.

184586.name: Lobos
184586.description:
User Summary:

Lobos is a d20 supplement that presents background and a racial template for a canine player character race for use in any d20 fantasy system. Lobos are canines with characteristics derived from dogs, wolves, and coyotes. Some Lobos are magically created as bodyguards; others are bred for battle; still others are "mass produced" by magical means.

Lobos may wear armor that is specially built for them, but generally they may not use weapons or other magic items inasmuch as they do not have hands. Their racial adjustments are: +2 Dex, +2 Con, +1 Wis, -2 Int. They have bonuses to several skills.

184587.name: A-B-C Gallery
184587.description:
A-B-C Gallery is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children the alphabet. It is included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. Each player takes a playing piece and 13 of the 26 letter tiles, with the letter on one side and a picture of something starting with the letter on the other side. The game board is laid out as a grid of square spaces, each with a letter and a picture. Players start on the first letter of their first name. Each player spins the spinner in turn and moves the number (1, 2 or 3) spaces spun. If they land on a space that matches one of their tiles, they choose the tile, flip it over to make sure the picture matches, then place it on the square. A player who matches on his or her first spin may then spin again, and continue to do so until a match is not made. Squares marked "Trade a Piece" allow the player to choose one of the opponent's pieces and the opponent to chose one of his or her pieces. The first player to match all his or her tiles wins.

The game may also be played with lower-case letter tiles, adding the challenge of matching the lower-case and upper-case letters.

184588.name: Wings!  The Remastered Edition
184588.description:
User Summary

A re-implementation of the earlier Wings games, you are given mission to shoot down enemy planes and balloons, strafe troops and trucks, and bomb targets and U-boats -- but primarily you shoot down enemy planes. You follow the journal of your character under the 56th squadron of Colonel Farrah, commenting on his humanity, cruelty, and the number of pilots who die in combat.

184589.name: Dino Egg Hunt!
184589.description: Dino Egg Hunt is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children color recognition. It is included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. Tokens with pictures of dinosaurs or dinosaur eggs are places randomly face-down on the spaces of a loop-shaped track. Each player chooses a dinosaur playing piece and places it on a color-coded start space. Each player in turn spins the spinner, moving one, two or three spaces. As they moves, players secretly look at each token they land on. If the egg on the token matches their dinosaurs' color, they keep the token. If not, it is returned to its space face-down. If a dinosaur appears on the token, the player immediately moves to that dinosaur's starting "nest" space and ends his or her turn. Players may choose to move along one of two short cuts when they reach them. The first player to collect all five eggs matching their color wins.

184590.description: Another in the legendary La Bataille series from the original designers, Marshal Enterprises. This title recreates Napoleon's first loss as the Archduke Charles stops the French from crossing the Danube at Lobau Island on May 21 & 22, 1809...over 1000 counters; 5 maps; a commemorative 170 plus page CD with OB's; special rules; historical commentary; 14 scenarios including the bonus game, La Bataille de Neumarkt--which recreates the Austrian Hiller's victory over the Bessieres French and Bavarian forces a month earlier than Aspern-Essling. Only 400 copies are being printed of Aspern-Essling. Game can be played with 2 players; multi-player teams or solitaire.
184590.name: La Bataille d'Aspern-Essling 1809

184591.name: Freak High
184591.description:
User Summary:

In Freak High, a rules-light RPG, the players have characters that are teenagers with super powers. Most of society is afraid of these teenagers and their abilities (and occasional physical mutations), and they have been co-located into special schools, away from population centers. The game transpires in Mountain High which, super powers aside, is much like any high school in America.

Characters have four major categories of Traits: Cliques, Comments, Angst, and Drama. Cliques are just like typical high school cliques and will define the social crowd the player likes to hang out with. Comments are narrative tags that help clarify the character's standing within the Clique, and one of the Comments will designate a "Power" which is the character's special ability or mutation. Angst summarizes the character's dramatic issues at the moment--"Acting on Angst in immature and petty ways is the central mechanic of the game." Drama is a resource through which characters can maximize their success.

Example Cliques are given: Jocks, Rebels, Princesses, Brains, and Basketcases. Each will have positive and negative comments. For example, Princesses may have these comments "Popular", "Natural Leader", "Manipulative", and "Emotionally Fragile."

Angst should be phrased in such a way as to introduce a problem or conflict which will provide the story seed for a game session. For example, "I can't let anyone know that my family is really poor."

Powers should be things like super strength or telepathy, but preferably will include some type of emotional investment. The game does not include lengthy lists of powers--players should design their own using the three parameters provided in the rules--simplicity, impermanent, and not cosmic.

When conflict occurs, it can be built with narrative until a power is used. Then a die roll will determine the outcome. Drama points can be spent to enlarge the dice pool to provide better outcomes. The character may also use narrative to make the conflict more significant which may also increase the dice pool.

184592.name: Short and Long Vowel Dominoes
184592.description: Short and Long Vowel Dominoes is an educational twist on traditional dominoes designed to teach short and long vowel sounds. In this game, dominoes have combinations of short vowels, long vowels and pictures. Each player draws six dominoes. Dominoes are played in a single line. Dominoes may be laid down by matching vowel to vowel, a vowel to a picture with the matching vowel sound, or tow pictures with the same vowel sound. If a player cannot make a match, he or she draws a domino and passes to the next player. Double dominoes are played sideways in the line, and afterward players may play on either end of the original domino line or off either end of the double domino. If necessary, a list of vowel sounds for each picture is included so players may check their plays. The first player to place all his or her dominoes wins. If no player can lay a domino, the player with the fewest dominoes wins.

184593.name: Gears & Spears
184593.description:
Mythic Tribal Robot Fantasy in the Year 200,000,000 A.D.

User Summary:

In Gears & Spears, players will create characters known as Onics--sentient robots that live in the far-flung future long after humanity has ceased to exist. Much of the rules establish the sense of setting, where these sentient robots live in a fantasy world of low technology, not realizing their nature is peculiarly anachronistic.
