Put more simply, fluff are those confusing little things that seem both natural and out of place during your dream but whose meaning sometimes becomes clear once you wake up and have time to think about it ("Oh! So, that’s where that came from.").

That is the definition of fluff as described in the Dreamwalker: Roleplaying in the Land of Dreams core rulebook. In retrospect we feel that it did not adequately emphasize the limitless possibilities and/or significance of fluff.

184793.name: The Earth of the Fourth Sun

rpg.28368: The Earth of the Fourth Sun

184793.description:
User summary:

Character creation is based on a point pool which is debited for every aspect of creation. Characters are first assigned Attributes (Mind, Body, Spirit, Magic Resistance, Physical Resistance, and Life Points). Characters may pay for Advantages or receive points back for Disadvantages; there are numerous types of both.

Characters also receive Skills from a fairly lengthy list divided into categories. Many Skills are special combat maneuvers. Spells are treated as a special kind of skill and are purchased individually. Characters also receive Gifts or Innate Talents, but generally these are quite expensive.

Resolution of opposed actions or Skill use is determined by die roll, but the game uses specialized dice for different situations. There are fifteen different dice symbols that appear on a variety of dice--geometrically, they are cubes and could be mimicked (not easily) with standard d6.

The Spell system is fairly unique inasmuch as a character that knows a spell may use it as frequently as desired--there are no daily limits and no spell points. In this respect, a spell represents a type of magical skill. However, magic is somewhat unpredictable. Combat is advanced and includes numerous options and special maneuvers, though a simplified combat system also is supported.

184794.name: The Earth of the Fourth Sun: Combat Revision

rpg.28368: The Earth of the Fourth Sun

184794.description:
User summary:

This document was released in 2005 and is intended as a full replacement for Chapter 5: Combat of the rule book. While the original rules for combat work, this supplement corrects several errors, incorporates errata, and provides an easier to follow structure for understanding the combat round.

184795.description:
Includes nine wooden colonies, six D6, and 1 Scoring Rocket. Sets available separately in pink or gray.

Published as promotional items for the international version release, Alien Frontiers: Aurora.
184795.name: Alien Frontiers: Bit Kit

184796.name: Quick Character Template

rpg.28368: The Earth of the Fourth Sun

184796.description:
User summary:

This document assists in rapid character creation by listing all Attributes, Skills, and Spells available in the game. Players can use the sheet as a checkoff to allocate the character creation point pool correctly. After this process the data can be transferred to a permanent character record.

184797.name: Dark Frontier
184797.description:
Dark Frontier is a space battle game with more than 200 different cards, where brave captains face each other for conquering the Galaxy.

The development team of Dark Frontier has been working for more than three years to achieve an unique card game, in which you will find:

- The Campaign Manual. A 252 pages book with the history of Dark Frontier, the backstory of our six factions, three thousand years of human history, a poster of the galaxy, and three complete ways for playing Dark Frontier. All this content can be downloaded for free on PDF!

- Three playing modes for competitive and casual players:
Through Campaign Mode you will experience the history of Dark Frontier in more than thirty replayable scenarios, both solo or versus another player.
In Duel Mode , normal or narrative, you will confront your friends or tournament enemies to obtain victory through conquest or destruction of a planet.
In Multiplayer Mode, you will enjoy frenzied games or political discussions for three players or more. This mode can also be played against the AI as a team.

- Six different victory or defeat conditions. Colonize the galaxy, gather crystals, destroy either enemy’s spaceship or planet, or make your opponents abandon their mission.

- A 140 pages graphic novel, tying the history of this first Dark Frontier set with the upcoming mini set, whose development is already finished and will be released for free during the next campaign.

The boxset content is designed to be halfway between a TCG and a LCG: is a collectible game without any random boosters. Boxsets contain all game cards, thus eliminating chance and extra costs for the player.

Choose your spaceship, select your mission, build your deck and plan your strategy to win the game!!

The contents of Dark Frontier Starter Box is:

1 rulebook

248 cards:

Orders cards (red back): 80 cards
Army cards (blue back) 165 cards
Spaceship cards (green back): 3 cards




47 cardboard markers:

3 colonization area markers
3 crystal markers
31 square markers
10 triangular markers

27026.name: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

184798.description:
A promo blueprint card.

Once built, you will win automatically on your next turn.
184798.name: Age of Craft: Rebel Army

184799.name: City States
184799.description:
City States is a board game depicting Ancient Greece and its' city states during the Classical until the Pre-hellenistic era.
Each round

At the start of each round, players are dealt historical personalities from each period like Leonidas, Pericles, Pausanias, Themistocles etc. Each such historical figure is attached to a specific city state.

Their role remains hidden as they secretly lay out plans during the round, beneficial for their city state (for example, fortify a city, build or improve temples, barracks etc. train/recruit soldiers) or detrimental to other city states like sabotage, war, espionage etc.

At the end of the round, all plans are revealed and resolved. Players gain victory points accordingly.

The winner of the game is the player with the most victory points.

184800.description:
The ancient Greek world was ruled by the Olympian gods, 12 beings of immense power, but also victims to their own feelings, passions and vices.
They vied for supremacy very often even amongst themselves, sometimes through brute force like hurling bolts of lightning, but they also conspired against each other through guile and intricate machinations.
This is the game the gods were playing when they tried to consolidate their power by working in the shadows, manipulating mortals to do their bidding, either showering them with promises of immortality and other divine gifts, or bending them to their will with dreadful threats and curses. The gods would compete against each other in a contest of wits and tactics, having the heroes of ancient Greece face mythical creatures and threats and gain glory in their name.

Deus ex Machina is a competitive game for 2 to 4 players with an innovative hero placement mechanism in which each player takes the role of an Olympian god trying to achieve supremacy over the other gods via manipulation of heroes and behind the scenes planning. Their ultimate goal is to accumulate the most Glory Points by having heroes complete quests. The winner of the game is the player who has completed his secret objective.
184800.name: Deus Ex Machina

rpgseries.26090: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System

184801.name: Slip
184801.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our universe is on the verge of a catastrophic collision.

Shadowy invaders from other worlds have begun to slip into the dark places in ours. The result? Night terrors, disappearances, deaths, and worse. Most people try to hide their heads in the sand, but members of the group known as Vigilance stand between our world and the darkness outside.

In Slip by Chris Caporaso, play a Vigilance member afflicted with strange powers linked to the convergence of worlds, or even a determined mundane. Knowledge is your only weapon.

Slip requires Fate Core to play. This 47-page supplement includes:

Simple rules for integrating psychic powers into character high concepts
Ideas on how to use campaign aspects to gradually reveal within game secrets over the course of a campaign
A basic structure to use when building an apocalypse campaign
Complete background for characters, organizations, and adventure ideas to get you quickly started within the world of Slip
A full adventure: The Sea From Beyond




Arm yourselves; stop the incursion, and try not to Slip.

184802.description:
Ironclad is a cooperative sci-fi game for 1 to 4 players.

Ironclad's story driven campaign puts you in the far future of our world, in the midst of a Cosmic Cold War era between various galactic spanning factions like the Human Federation, the Galactic Council etc.

Players are freelancers aboard the Ironclad, a powerful battleworn warship that defected from the Human Federation Armed Forces.

Each player will be tasked with controlling vital systems of the ship such as Navigation, Engineering or Weapons Systems by carefully managing and assigning hero crew members according to their needs.

In the campaign mode, players follow the game's narrative and choose their course of action. Their decisions and outcomes will have lasting effects on how the story evolves. Players will be tasked with completing missions for various factions from smuggling and collecting bounties to destroying formidable battle space stations or taking part in massive space battles.

Each mission uses the modular hexagonal board pieces to set up the space sector where the scenario takes place. Players have to reach their goal (they may also attempt to discover secret objectives that might lie in-between). During their journey they will encounter threats ranging from other hostile ships (pirates, warmongers etc.), or cosmic events (like solar flares or black holes)

Over the course of the campaign the crew will gain experience, thus improving its skills and with the rewards (credits or new technologies) gained, players will be able to upgrade their ship and outfit it with better weapons, shields, reactor etc., becoming famous or infamous (depending on choices made), building Ironclad's legend and making it a force to be reckoned with.

Ironclad features:

Narrative driven campaign with missions that will provide players with over 15 hours of content.
60 hexagon map tiles representing space stations, planets, cosmic events and the vastness of space.
A.I. controlled threats and events (enemy ships and cosmic events)
Customizable ship modules.
184802.name: Ironclad

184803.name: The Stygian Garden of Abelia Prem
184803.description:
From the Kickstarter campaign:

Abelia Prem was a peculiar woman. Born to a wealthy merchant family, she grew up with no desire unfulfilled. However, she did not inherit her family’s lust for wealth. She had ambitions to be a scholar, a traveler, and an explorer of unknown places. Throughout her life she studied, remaining bookish and reclusive while her siblings engaged in the more typical mating rituals of the idle rich. When her parents left her a sizable inheritance she built a secluded manor, a sanctuary of intellect away from what she saw as the crass, banal world around her.

In her middle age she was known for hosting extravagant salon parties for the local nobles, scholars, and bardic colleges. Her gardens were considered the most extraordinary in the region. Her study of horticulture continued well into her later life, when she developed an interest in rare and hybrid species of plants. This interest eventually led Abelia to discover a most interesting legend about the rarest flower of all, the Stygian Rose.

Supposedly this midnight black rose grew in compact bushes along the banks of the river Styx, the physical boundary between the realm of the living and the underworld. As a learned woman, she regarded this legend as common superstition until she came across the writings of the great adventurer Leopold Malando. In his journals, Malando described a chthonic expedition wherein he not only found this plant, but used it to restore life to one of his dead colleagues. Unfortunately for Abelia, this discovery occurred just prior to the dementia that claimed her mind in the last years of her life.

She became obsessed with the prospect of finding the Stygian Rose and adding it to her world-renowned garden. She contracted a team of dwarven diggers to tunnel below her gardens and search for the river of the dead. In the end, she may have found it. 10 years ago Abelia Prem vanished without a trace, leaving her property abandoned. In the months prior to her disappearance, she suddenly released her servants from duty in a fit of dementia. Neither Abelia Prem, nor her team of dwarves were ever seen again.

184804.name: Wizards & Weapons
184804.description:
User summary:

Characters have four attributes (Brawn, Balance, Brains, Body) that are generated randomly with d26. The game has four races (Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling), which may modify Attributes. There are six Skills and characters distribute five Skill Points among them--Combat, Magic, and Religion are all Skills. When Skills are used a dice pool is rolled (the number of dice depending upon the Skill level). Results of 5 and 6 are counted successes. Characters gain and spend Experience Points to raise Attributes, Skills, or gain new Spells. The game also presents a "monster matrix" of typical Attribute values by size.

184805.name: Boxing
184805.description:
From the introduction:

Boxing is the art of punching your opponent with the intention of knocking him unconscious. There's a lot more to it then that, of course, but that's the basic tenet. Boxing traditionally takes place inside a ring or arena. This supplement is meant as a quick guide for adding Boxing to your d20 games.

184806.name: EGO: Endless Gaming Options
184806.description:
User summary:

Ego is a generic, universal rules system for any genre of roleplaying. The game's final release was "Playtest Version 1.2" (28 April 2006) as a freely distributed PDF.

Characters have Abilities and Skills with numeric scores purchased from a point pool. Characters have four Abilities ranging up to 16 in score--Muscle, Agility, Intellect, Vitality. Each Ability score maps to a particular number of dice which will be used as a dice pool when rolling for activities based on that Ability. Characters also may have Advantages and/or Disadvantages. Characters begin also with Karma Points which are used during play to influence outcomes. Skills are resolved in the typical manner of rolling a dice pool against a target number. Combat is handled as a Skill though there are several special maneuvers noted. Magic and Psionics are defined in generic terms.

184807.name: Force 9 (EGO Version)
184807.description:
Force 9: A Science-Fiction Combat RPG

User summary:

Force 9 was originally released for the Fudge system. The game was adapted to use the EGO: Endless Gaming Options system by the EGO author. This modification with complete rules was then released as HTML on the web, incorporating EGO by reference.

184808.name: EGO Character Sheets
184808.description:
User summary:

EGO - Endless Gaming Options has two supporting characters sheets, a standard PDF version, and a Microsoft Excel (XLS) version. The Excel version partially automates the character creation process by the use of formulas.

184809.name: Eiridia
184809.description:
User summary:

Character generation starts with twelve Attributes which are randomly generated with 1d100 each. Life Force Points are next generated with 1d20 multiplied by several factors yielding something in the neighborhood of fifteen points.

Skills in the game are created by the players--there is no published Skill List. Characters have 1 to 20 Skills, depending on their Intelligence Attribute. Skills also have a percentage score attached to them, though they are assigned by GM fiat. To use the skill, the player rolls 1d100 and scores below the Skill level for success. Experience Points are gained in categories and are spent to increase Skills in that category. Combat and Magic use are handled as Skills. Damage is subtracted from Life Force Points.

The game presents a very short equipment list, heavily focused on weapons and armors from a variety of technology levels. A very brief Monster Creation format also is offered.

184810.name: The Red Zone Board Game
184810.description:
For the casual fan and the football addict! The Red Zone is a well balanced fast paced football game that allows novice and experienced football fans to feel the excitement of Pro football. With a balance of strategy and luck, the experienced player can play wisely to put the odds in their favor, but it won't always guarantee the victory.

Two teams can go head to head in a single game or multiple players can set up a league to see who will be The Red Zone champion!

Choose what plays to run and how to utilize your star players at crucial times. Will you run the ball for a shorter but surer gain? Will you pass the ball inside and outside to throw the defense off? Or perhaps you're a risk taker who likes to throw the long bomb!

Knowing your opponents tendencies, calling the right plays and managing the clock could be the difference between winning and losing the championship!

Both teams will be engaged on every play as you battle it out in this classic, fast-paced game of head-to-head football. As time begins to run out, you may be forced to change your strategy to save precious seconds on the clock. It won't be easy, the defense wants to force you to keep the clock moving!

Use the stat sheets provided to keep track of rival matches, league records, sacks, and other stats for personal records and bragging rights.

184811.name: Enchanted Realms
184811.description:
User summary:

The rule book includes eight pages of text rules and sixteen pages of printable color cards (usually 8 cards per page). As noted in the introductory material the card art often is taken from copyrighted sources or is fairly primitive.

Play is driven by the card pack and no GM is needed. Each player selects a Hero and a Creature card to play. The players select a single Quest card to share. The remaining cards are shuffled into the pack and each player is dealt five cards. Players equip their characters with Item and Enhancement cards from their hand and play World cards collectively to create the adventure map. Play proceeds with the lead player acting as GM in narration of events. In general, play follows the World Card directions to create the adventure which builds toward Quest completion. Draws and counter-draws may occur on each players hand in a round.

Various rules cover combat, healing, question completion, and card stacking. When characters advance in power (e.g., "gain a level", so to speak) they do so by adding a Hero or Enhancement card to their existing build. An alternative rule set allows for a dedicated GM who arbitrates the game (though in most respects will not have much to do by comparison to a standard roleplaying GM position).

184822.description:
In Nadaras, players start as faction leader planning their perilous journey to Nadaras, a mechanical island mysteriously appeared in the middle of the ocean. Every attempt to establish an outpost on its metal shores failed and just one survivor returned, telling tales of horror ad riches beyond imagination. The Emperor himself tasked the bravest and most resourceful nobles to claim the island in his name with the promise of eternal power and glory.

To win the game you have to develop your faction according to several different aspects: military power, territory, knowledge, fame and influence over the imperial court. To fulfil this objective players have to explore the island and exploit its resources to support the growth of their settlement and armies. The resources are found on tiles that are randomly spread across the game board.
Turn by turn you have the opportunity to make wondrous scientific discoveries or exploit the natural magic of the island to unlock new structures for your settlement or units for your army. Exceptionally gifted individuals, heroes, will become your field agents, discovering the deepest and darkest secrets of this island.
Conflicts over territory or resources are common between factions and, far from imperial supervision, what really matters is the end not the means to reach it. The island itself, however, reacts to human presence, trying to reestablish order by cleansing the land from all living beings.

What pathway will you choose to become the Emperor’s favorite? Force, wealth, fame or knowledge?

Will you cultivate science or rediscover lost magic?

All this and much more is Nadaras!
184822.name: Dark Tales of Nadaras

184823.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Perilous Island, the first Campaign book for Pulp Alley. Prepare to embark on a journey of global scale, venturing from the deserts of Mexico, to the streets of Athens, to the docks of Indonesia, and ending on the Perilous Island. This thrilling campaign is sure to test your characters to their limits."

The book also includes rules for Terrors, Weird Abilities and Perks, Minions, Gifts, Cults, Water and Bursts. Also included are more Fortune Cards, Profiles for Predators and an expanded Harrowing Escape table.
184823.name: Perilous Island

184824.name: Gaslands
184824.description:
Gaslands is a game of post-apocalyptic vehicular mayhem.

Gaslands is a tabletop wargame of car-on-car destruction in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Players form a racing team, and compete for money and fame, scrapping in between races for the resources they need for the next race.

Movement consists of movement templates and custom "skid dice" to create a fluid and madcap game.

184825.description:
Sapiens: Mountains is a set of eight landscape tiles for Sapiens with one-half of each tile being one of the eight normal landscape tiles and the other half of each tile being a mountain, which is what surrounds the valley on each individual's playing board.

During set-up, place these eight mountain tiles next to the scoreboard. During play, instead of placing a tile from your personal pool onto your player board, you can place one of these mountain tiles, with the mountain half lying outside the normal play area and the other half matching an adjacent tile (and scoring food points and a bonus) like usual; if you cover a cave with the mountain half of the tile, you earn no shelter points for this placement.
184825.name: Sapiens: Mountains

184827.name: Its an NPC World
184827.description:
From publisher blurb:

Any game world will be composed of a vast array of individuals that are not player characters. These non-player characters make up 99.99+% of the civilized population yet there are only five standard non-player character classes used to represent this bounty of colorful and unique individuals that fill every strata within the game world from the mightiest of emperors to the lowliest of serfs. This supplement offers a quantifiable collection of 16 new NPC classes based loosely from the player character classes. NPC archetypes are also introduced, offering 34 different archetypes spread between all five original NPC classes.

So whether it is a cocky pickpocket the manages to slip out a treasure map or treasured scroll from a wondering player character or a run in with the local bone doctor and his undead minions, there is a plethora of possibilities using these new classes and archetypes.

184828.name: Frozen Ship
184828.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Ship in Ice.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“If we can reach those dinghies, we can drag them to the sea and get off this icy rock.”—Stranded Survivor

Frozen Ship is am exterior map of frozen tundra with a crashed three-mast sailing ship embedded in the ice in the east. The frozen ship has two dinghies on its upper deck on the starboard side.

Frozen Ship is intended for use in fantasy, modern, and post-apocalyptic games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Stranded!: The group has crash landed on an Arctic or Antarctic land mass after their modern icebreaker had a catastrophic accident that sunk the vessel with only the group as survivors (or a few other NPCs that managed to live if the play group is small). Their initial exploration of the surrounding area has found nothing nearby. Following the icy shore eastward they eventually come across an ancient sailing vessel that has been trapped in the ice for a long time. The survivors spot some old dinghies on the upper deck that might be seaworthy and give them a shot at getting off the frozen rock that may become their tomb. The ship itself might offer some shelter from the cold and icy winds.

Investigating the ship, the group finds well preserved bodies of the ships’ crew. They appear to have frozen to death. The ship’s crew could be Vikings, pirates, privateers, etc. As the group explores the area, they find time period appropriate weapons and armor such as axes or muskets (but the powder shot is virtually useless with all the ice and snow but makes a good club or bayonet with a knife).

The group starts hearing cracking sounds. Investigation of previously explored rooms finds the bodies of the corpses missing. The longer the group remains inside the ship more and more shattering noises are heard.

The group might decide that now would be a good time to get those boats and get off the island. Unfortunately the group hears shuffling behind them as they flee the inside of the vessel. Zombies covered in ice and snow wielding axes or muskets as clubs chase the group up the sides of the ship, coveting the warmth of their bodies that was denied them as they froze to death. The group needs to get off this island and the dinghies might be their only chance. Making things more difficult is the tough terrain of ice and snow that slows the group down giving the ice zombies a chance to catch up and eat the group…

184829.name: September 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Spell-Sucker
184829.description:
From publisher blurb:

Regarded by arcane scholars as “possibly the most annoying creature that one may ever have misfortune of meeting,” due to their ability to absorb and regurgitate magic—not to mention their boundless enthusiasm and constant, high-pitched whooping—spell-suckers are as dangerous as they are irritating.

184830.name: Longhorn
184830.description:
From publisher blurb:

WELCOME TO THE CITY OF SPIRITS!

Welcome to Meriquai Falls, where Native American culture blends seemlessly with modern contemporary society to form one of the most beautiful cities in the United States. It is also home to one of the largest concentrations of metahuman activity in the Midwest. Between the schemes of Galvakar and his Imperions and the genocidal plots of the Manitou and his Totems of Retribution, the crazed antics of the Pooka King and the dark secrets of the Night Sparrow, there is plenty to do for an intrepid hero in Meriquai Falls. Save the city and perhaps, in so doing, save the world!

MEET LONGHORN!

Born of humanity's greed and disrespect for nature, fueled by his desire to avenge cruelty to bovine everywhere, Longhorn is a juggernaut of a villain to contend with. Easily the strongest creature alive in Meriquai Falls, Longhorn can wreck devastating damage through his mighty sinews alone... let alone the vast army of cattle he commands. Can your heroes stop this rampaging berserker?

Meriquai Falls - Longhorn includes HERO System 6th Edition stats for the villain Longhorn, as well as plot seeds to get him quickly into your Meriquai Falls campaign.

184831.name: Live-Wire
184831.description:
From publisher blurb:

WELCOME TO THE CITY OF SPIRITS!

Welcome to Meriquai Falls, where Native American culture blends seemlessly with modern contemporary society to form one of the most beautiful cities in the United States. It is also home to one of the largest concentrations of metahuman activity in the Midwest. Between the schemes of Galvakar and his Imperions and the genocidal plots of the Manitou and his Totems of Retribution, the crazed antics of the Pooka King and the dark secrets of the Night Sparrow, there is plenty to do for an intrepid hero in Meriquai Falls. Save the city and perhaps, in so doing, save the world!

LIVE-WIRE!

Trent MacDailey was a man simply trying to live day by day when he became victim of the collateral damage of a supervillain attack. Imbued with the ability to absorb and channel electricity, he rose to become the protector of his home neighborhood, the now aptly-named Rampage Row. But will he work with the rest of the heroes of Meriquai Falls or against them? Only time will tell.

Meriquai Falls - Live-Wire includes HERO System 6th Edition stats for the hero Live-Wire, as well as plot seeds to get him quickly into your Meriquai Falls campaign.

184832.name: Wizard-Spawned Insanities
184832.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Monthly Monsters project is back with another monster manual for Dungeon World!

Wizard-Spawned Isanities includes 13 monster entries, illustrated in full colour, along with a host of variations, random tables, adventures, dangers and their grim portents, custom moves, items, locations, plot hooks, secrets, and more.

This is NOT just a reprint of the Monthly Monster material! Each monster has been revised, expanded, and given new illustrations. Every page contains full-colour background art.

184833.name: The Wyrm of Regret
184833.description:
From publisher blurb:

All over the multiverse, on many different planes of existence, psychic crystals develop in small colonies, in seemingly random location. Practitioners of the psionic arts from one end of creation to the other covet them in order to enhance their special abilities, for there are few enough methods to do so, and none as safe and sure.

Harvesters do their best to keep up with the high demand, but they have problems of their own, for there is also another predator on the hunt for these clusters of mental energy in crystalline form. Rare enough that no one is actually sure how many there are — or if there are even more than one — the Wyrm of Regret lives up to its name, for there is no one happy to have encountered it, even though they escaped with their lives.

It roams the jagged burnlands when the stars are right, under a night sky filled with tiny pinpricks of twinkling light, a strange, bestial creature from beyond time and space — so they say — that swallows people whole. Inside it’s bulbous gullet, nothing could be further from the terrestrial concepts of consumption.

184834.name: The Wyrm of Regret
184834.description:
From publisher blurb:

All over the multiverse, on many different planes of existence, psychic crystals develop in small colonies, in seemingly random location. Practitioners of the psionic arts from one end of creation to the other covet them in order to enhance their special abilities, for there are few enough methods to do so, and none as safe and sure.

Harvesters do their best to keep up with the high demand, but they have problems of their own, for there is also another predator on the hunt for these clusters of mental energy in crystalline form. Rare enough that no one is actually sure how many there are — or if there are even more than one — the Wyrm of Regret lives up to its name, for there is no one happy to have encountered it, even though they escaped with their lives.

It roams the jagged burnlands when the stars are right, under a night sky filled with tiny pinpricks of twinkling light, a strange, bestial creature from beyond time and space — so they say — that swallows people whole. Inside it’s bulbous gullet, nothing could be further from the terrestrial concepts of consumption.

184835.name: Mercurial
184835.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once a driven college student, Glenna Frost was transformed into the highly unstable (in body and mind) Mercurial in an accident at KessKorp. Now Mercurial sows chaos and danger for whatever reason she thinks makes the most sense today. Can the heroes defeat her? Can they help her? Do they want to, after all she’s done?

184836.name: IGT-92
184836.description:
From publisher blurb:

Smuggled to Earth in a bid to make some money for alien criminals, things would have been fine if they hadn’t turned IGT-92 on to make sure it worked. Now escaped and on the run, IGT-92 is executing its programming to “soften up” the planet to prepare the way for its alien masters—even if they never come.

184837.name: The Devil's Advocates
184837.description:
From publisher blurb:

A gang filled with evil bikers blessed with Satanic powers! They spend their time terrorizing decent folk and picking up jobs from more powerful criminal organizations that need a bit of extra muscle. The four leaders of the Devil’s Advocates have serious power with supernatural origins!

184838.name: Eastern Europe
184838.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Atlas of Earth-Prime travels to Eastern Europe, where it introduces you to the Barony of Volkavia, which is ruled by the benevolent Baroness Natasha Von Volkavia. Then on to Poland, Romania, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Hungary, and the former Soviet Union. Along the way, we meet Poland’s famous Knight, the dogmatic European, a summary of the different vampires in and from the region, and much more.

184839.name: North Africa
184839.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Atlas of Earth-Prime takes us to North Africa! It explores the countries of Egypt, Libya, Algeria, Tunisia, Tazamamart, Mauritania, and even covers the Western Sahara and Morroco. This region is rich in history, mythology, and culture. Inside you’ll learn about SHADOW’s role in the region, find out about the Hand of Horus, discover what Black Anubis is up to now, and much more, including Tunisia’s plan to build a “Super City” and Morocco’s role as a place of neutrality in the super-powered world!

184840.name: Dolphins, Guns, and Money
184840.description:
From publisher blurb:

Working for a salvage company as a reclamation technician is rarely a dull job. Most of the time you’re diving into waters to recover something that belongs to someone else, because you were paid to retrieve it or because there’s profit in recovering and selling it. But that water is never the beautiful, peaceful, shallow sea you see on holovids. It’s too deep for casual salvagers to attempt, or in waters teeming with dangerous creatures, or located in areas frequented by violent insurgents or protected by Incorporate soldiers. Any way you look at it, it’s not an easy job. So when a client shows up at your door with a fairly simple job, you jump on it.

The client in this case was a bottlenose dolphin who went by the name of Surfjumper. She was a courier and transporter, specializing in delivering small cargoes discreetly. Her latest job was hauling a cargo pod of scientific monitoring equipment and the resulting data from a small island about 700 kilometers north of Second Try.

The haul went without incident until approximately 62 kilometers south of Summer Island, a lesser white appeared at the extreme edge of her echolocation and assumed a hunting pattern. Surfjumper attempted to lose the white by using the terrain, but she couldn’t maneuver quickly enough with the cargo pod. She dumped the cargo pod, noting the coordinates, and proceeded to evade the white. However, when she circled back, the white had returned to the area where she dumped the pod. It refused to leave the area, forcing her to abandon the cargo pod and seek help.

Being an independent courier, she had no resources to call on, so she came to your company to hire you to retrieve the cargo pod for her. She will pay the standard rate plus danger money, even if the white is no longer in the area. The water is just over 600 meters deep, which is not that bad. All you have to do is return the pod to her at Dock Berth 94 in Second Try as soon as possible.

Easy money, right?

184841.name: Sneeze: The Card Game
184841.description:
Sneeze is all about staying as healthy as possible while making sure that you're not too healthy and that everyone else has more infections than you. Be infected and infect others.

It's not good enough to simply get rid of all your germs. Players have to strategically infect themselves and cure themselves and others to win.

The last player who is not too sick wins. For three or more players, a player is too sick once infected with five different colored infections. While a too sick player can't win the game, he or she continues to play and infect other players.

184842.description:
This revised edition of Catan Junior includes the new rules of Catan Junior Madagascar.

It plays two to four players, rather than three to four. The new board is printed on both sides. One side for two players (new) and the other side is for 3-4 players.

Changes from earlier versions:

- new board
- 2 gold islands (old: 1)
- 5 life rings on the board (old: market)
- no Harbour tiles (old: 4)
- generally all Tokens (old: cards)
- resource pineapple (old: rum)
- new colours lilac and bright yellow (old: White and yellow/orange)
- parrot as robber (old: pirate)

---

Die Siedler von Catan: Junior is a junior edition of The Settlers of Catan. Players collect and trade resources in order to build things, gain more resources and score points. The first player to build seven warehouses wins.
184842.name: Catan Junior

184843.description:
It's hard being a cult leader. Your underlings are incompetent, madness is eminent and a good sacrifice is hard to find. If you can avoid your competitors tricks and stave off insanity maybe the stars will align and you will summon an old one.

Cultists & Cthulhu is an fast, humorous, "take that" style card game in which you want to complete the Ritual card in front of you. The card has both a Success value and a Ritual value; using Cultists cards, you roll dice to try to meet or exceed the Success value. When you do, you collect the Ritual (and the points). The first player to complete 21 points worth of Rituals is the winner. Sacrifices, Books and other cards can add to your roll, while Tentacle, Insanity, and other cards can take away.
184843.name: Cultists & Cthulhu

184844.description:
From the publisher:

Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy's tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.

This expansion includes components to add a fifth or sixth player to your game of Treasure Tomb!
184844.name: Treasure Tomb: 5-6 Player Expansion

184845.name: The Chaining Stones
184845.description:
From publisher blurb:

Centuries ago, the Priest-Kings of Theyeria made a pact with a creature of the deep. In return for the safe passage of their ships across the sea, the Priest-Kings offered the creature offerings of gold and gems. The creature was black-hearted though, and over time demanded more - until eventually the Priest-Kings offered the lives of their subjects. And now, even though the kingdom of Theyeria is no more, the people that live in the area are made to honour the legacy of that pact. Criminals, beggars, strangers - anyone can be a suitable offering at the Chaining Stones.

Need a quick map for an encounter?
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map a sacrificial altar and location at the top of a cliff. Rough-hewn stone steps rise up from the sea to a raised area with four pillars. Rusty metal chains can be used to restrain victims between the stones. The rest of the map depicts cliffs, beaches and ruined structures from the past.

184846.description:
From the publisher:

Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy’s tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.

This product is an expansion and cannot be played without the components from the basic game and the 5-6 player expansion. This expansion includes components to add a seventh or eighth player to your game of Treasure Tomb!
184846.name: Treasure Tomb 7-8 Player Expansion

184847.name: Utah Geek Magazine (Issue 7 - Sep/Oct 2015)
184847.description:
Utah Geek Magazine
Issue 7
September/October 2015

Serenity & Firefly - Celebrating 10 Years
ToshoCON

184848.name: Sangokushi Haou
184848.description:
The strategy cardgame based on historical novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". Many characters represent by cards. "Sangokushi Haou" is means the Champion of the Three Kingdoms.

Players control one of five warlords. In each turn, player can perform three actions in the order specified: attack a province, draw one card and reorganization in own provinces.
The battle is resolve three steps: stratagem, duel and army combat. These affected by characters.

Winner determined by victory points, mostly gain from control of provinces.

184849.name: Grin
184849.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Grin is a free game of survival horror.

It is a rules light survival horror roleplaying system that fits on a single page. It uses a standard deck of Playing Cards as its core resolution mechanic - no dice are needed.

Fast and deadly, Grin is perfect for high mortality single session games or one shots.

The mechanics lend themselves to improvised or impromptu play with a focus on shaping memorable narratives of terror, suspense, and dread.

Will you survive?

184850.description:
This expansion for Krosmaster: Arena was released exclusively in the form of blind boxes. A case of 12 figurines, comes with 4 random rares and one each of the 8 commons. There is a chance the figure will be a "chase" variant, with a gold-painted base and foil card.

The list of figures in the set is as follows:

1. Kanniball Archer
2. Kanniball Sarbak
3. Kanniball Jav
4. Kanniball Thierry
5. Kanniball Andchain
6. Moon
7. Dreggoog the Downunder
8. Dragossiper the Nag
9. Dragostess
10. Crocabulia
11. Hazwonarm
12. Boomba
13. Buck Anear
14. Deminoball
15. Minotoror
16. Otomai
184850.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Season 3

184851.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You don't fear hospitals, don't you? You'd better not, because here are nine more tiles to create the meanest of hospitals in Zombicide, filled with patients in terminal case of zombie infection! Or it will be a refugee camp. Or a secret laboratory. Or anything you can imagine for a zombie town! Say "Aaaaaah!"
184851.name: Zombicide Season 3: Rue Morgue – Game Tiles

184852.name: Asylum
184852.description:
From the Introduction:

St. Mary's Asylum was condemned in 1984. But that won't stop a group of high school friends going there as the sun sets with the intent to stay the night.
It is supposedly haunted. Legend says that a group of highschoolers tried to stay the night twenty years ago and disappeared.
St. Mary's was originally a sanatorium called Oak Hill until tuberculosis was cured.
It was renamed after Sister Mary, a nun who took it over in the 60's.
It was meant to be used as a home for the criminally insane.
They say Mary was a monster who punished patients for their perceived sins.
Rumors of her bloody reign can be gleaned in tales of forced sterilization, shock therapy, and lobotomies.
Legend goes, one night there was a great storm and the power failed.
The patients got out of their locked rooms and they say they found her, dragged her into the operating room, and chopped her to bits.

184853.description:
Publisher Blurb:

How big is your neighborhood? Time for some urban expansion! This set contains three double sided gaming tiles to create the angriest neighborhood you can imagine in Zombicide. There are more rooms, holes everywhere, doors to destroy, zombie spawn zones and even an alternate version of Zombicide Season 3's helicopter. Now your turf is the biggest in town, but watch for your neighbors...they may get angry. Zombie angry !
184853.name: Zombicide: Angry Neighbors – Game Tiles

184854.name: Torchlight
184854.description:
From the Introduction:

They said there is darkness below the old ruins out on the moor. We entered with fantasies of treasure and glory, and now our last torch flickers, casting shadows on cold and silent stone, but we must not speak, lest the echoes of our hoarse whispers unsettle the restless dead...

184855.name: The King's Armory: Kickstarter exclusive extras
184855.description:
During the King's Armory Kickstarter, several extras were included for backers that are not available via retail.

They include:

Backup Reinforcement Card
Special Aid Reinforcement Card

184856.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Plastic Token Pack contains 74 plastic tokens, including Spawn Zones, Exit Zone, Objectives, Noise and Skill markers. The contents of the pack are sufficient to play any mission from Season 1, Season 2, Season 3, Toxic City Mall or Angry Neighbors! These high-quality tokens are made of hard plastic with embossed and painted features.
184856.name: Zombicide: Plastic Tokens Pack

184857.name: The King's Armory: Reward Expansion Set
184857.description:
This expansion set comes with three additional "Reward" cards and one new monster named "Mr. Money Bags".

The cards are:

The Empty Coin Purse – worth 0 Gold
The Treasure Chest – worth two extra draws
The Imperial Diamond – worth 300 Gold

184858.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Featuring iconic art from the DC Comics Heroes Unite Deck-Building Game storyline, this play mat can be used as a game board accessory or simply enjoyed as a celebration of the beautiful artwork from the game.

boardgameaccessory.142852: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite

184858.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite – Playmat

184859.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Featuring iconic art from the Forever Evil storyline, this play mat can be used as a game board accessory or simply enjoyed as a celebration of the beautiful artwork from the game. New features on the Forever Evil play mat include space to store your Victory Point tokens and Frozen tokens during the game.

boardgameaccessory.155463: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil

184859.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil – Playmat

184860.name: The King's Armory: Firepower Expansion Set
184860.description:
This expansion comes with "The Elder Wyrm Dragon" Boss monster and "The Magma Cannon" armory card.

The Elder Wyrm Dragon has 2 movement modes, and 3 Attack Options, and uses Status Effects against the heroes.

184861.name: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Scout vs. Grenadier
184861.description:
From the publisher:

Grab a Mech and get to fighting... fast! Based on the free-to-play FPS, HAWKEN, you will pilot a Mech with the goal of knocking out your opponent's Mech. In Hawken: Real-Time Card Game, your deck of cards contains primary and secondary weapons systems, thrusters, special abilities, and various other high-tech instruments of war. Draw cards and place them onto the table as fast as you can, but be careful or you might overheat! The action is in real-time, but a game round ends when a player snags the FIRE! button from the center of the table. Quick reflexes are helpful, but a quick mind will win every time!

184862.name: Mutant: Year Zero: GM Screen
184862.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The official game master screen for the award winning Mutant: Year Zero is of the same top production quality as the core rulebook itself. It is made out of four sections of 3 mm thick hardback, measuring a mighty 872 x 279 mm when unfolded. The outside features beautiful full color artwork, and the inside contains all of the tables and charts needed to create the Zone, build the Ark and fight deadly battles in the world of Mutant: Year Zero.

184863.name: The King's Armory: Robin Hood the Sharpshooter
184863.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184864.name: The King's Armory: Asphar the Barbarian
184864.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184865.name: The King's Armory: Rhette the Pirate
184865.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184866.description: It is 1916, and the First World War continues with no end in sight. With the war a bloody stalemate on the ground, the combatants have turned to their developing air forces to achieve victory. Wings for the Baron allows 3-5 players to take the role of German aeroplane manufacturers, supplying the machines needed to drive the Allied air forces from the skies and ensure German victory. Compared to the first edition it features expanded and streamlined rules, a fifth player, an advanced game featuring reconnaissance and bomber aeroplane development.
184866.name: Wings for the Baron (second edition)

184867.name: B.I.A.
184867.description:
User Summary'

B.I.A: Bureau of Indian Affairs. Play agents of the B.I.A. investigating on the border of reality.

A modern investigative RPG with bits of horror, fantastic and whatever your imagination will drive you to.

This game uses the dk System.

This book bundle is all you need to play. It contains the rules, the background, a few scenario and the game master screen.

184868.name: The King's Armory: Artaxerxes the Jester
184868.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184869.name: The King's Armory: Zoe the Ninja
184869.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184870.name: The King's Armory: Alexian the War King
184870.description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.

184871.name: Do Men Really Know Women?
184871.description:
Description from the official website:

"Do Men Really Know Women is a game that will reveal who knows the most about the other sex. The ultimate battle between the sexes. The 2 teams, men and women, must show their strength in categories that belong to the world of the opposite sex :

Men: Fashion, Home, Personal Care, Chick Flicks Women: Hobby & Engineering, Transportation, Sports, Movies

…And women must bet on what they think is typically men and men have to bet on what they think turns on women – and vice versa. All very interesting questions that might result in surprising answers!"

184872.name: The King's Armory: Fairytale Expansion Set
184872.description:
This expansion set contains:


The Sheriff of Nottingham Boss card.
4 Fairytale themed Reinforcement Cards (Puss in Boots, The Frog Prince, The Pied Piper and The Three Musketeers.)
1 Iron John Armory card

184873.name: Dilemma: Mads & Monopolet
184873.description:
Bet on what your friends would do in fun, embarrassing and uncomfortable situations.
On your turn, you are given a dilemma and have to chose, from three options, what you would do in that situation.
The other players must then guess on what you would do, and the ones that are correct will advance on the scoring track.

184874.description:
This expansion pack adds more map tiles, and more map options to The King's Armory game. The tiles are available in one large lot, or piecemeal.

The standard lot comes with:
8 additional Straight Tiles.
2 additional Elbow Tiles.
4 Switcher Tiles. (These are not included in the base game)
2 4-Way Intersection Tiles. (These are not included in the base game)
4 Border Extension Tiles (3 Forest, 1 Castle) to allow for the larger map.
184874.name: The King's Armory: Map Expansion Pack

184875.description:
This is a set of 11 metal 35mm miniatures to replace the cardboard hero tokens in the base game and expansions. These miniatures are available in both Pewter and Bronze.

The list of Heroes included is:

Valcor the Warrior
Midnight the Sorceress
Ember the Ranger
Felicity the Master Cleric
Cyrus the Psionic Warrior
Raphael the Psion
Boleslaw the Mage
Asphar the Barbarian
Zoe the Ninja
Artaxerxes the Jester
Rhette the Pirate

These miniatures are available as a set of 11, or piecemeal.
184875.name: The King's Armory: Metal Miniatures

184876.description:
This is a set of 35 10mm Acrylic Crystals to replace the status effect cardboard tokens.

Included are:

9 Red Bleed Tokens
9 Orange Burn Tokens
9 Blue Slow Tokens
4 Green Stun Tokens
4 Yellow Bless Tokens
184876.name: The King's Armory: BBSSB Acrylic Gems

184877.description: This comes with a custom d12 die and a standard playing card sized wave chart. This accessory replaces the large monster spawning chart, in attempt to speed the process of setting up for each new wave of monsters.
184877.name: The King's Armory: Monster Selection Wave Die

184878.name: Battleforce Saturn
184878.description:
Fast-Paced Tactical Starship Combat Card Game

In the late part of the 21st century Mankind is fighting for domination of the resources of his solar system.

In this card game of star ship fleet combat, 2 players select ships cards and play weapons/tactics cards in furious, and fast-paced action!

There are prepared scenarios and random battles and players can design their own scenarios as well. Play is fast and clean and easy! A good game for a short evening of starship combat fun!


Spacecraft range from small frigates, destroyers, cruisers, light & heavy cruisers, fighter carriers, dreadnaughts and battleships.



Weapons range from turbo lasers, rail guns, and drones, to torpedoes and boarding parties.



Each game is placed in a battlefield setting from planetary rings, asteroid fields, star bases, open space, etc. Each battlefield type has specific but simple rules for combat.



8 "Historical" scenarios follow the great Solar Civil War! The Scenario booklet can be downloaded separately as a PDF in "downloads" below (after purchase of the game).



Simple ship value-point system for keeping score.



Dice rolling for weapons fire and tactics resolution.

184879.name: Mahola
184879.description:
The four most respected members of the tribe, the Chief, Hunter, Maiden and Shaman, have come together, each seeking the favor of the Great Spirit. To win that favor, each must perform a ritual dance, with the best dance earning the desired divine favor.

Mahola is a card game for 3 to 4 players themed around the beautiful dances of the Native American culture. Players will draw, play, and pass cards in order to create the highest scoring dance and win a favor token. The first to win 3 tokens wins the game.

184880.name: Das Häschenspiel
184880.description: The bunnies hop from nest to nest and deliver their easter eggs. Movement ist determined by a color-die. The first bunny to deliver an egg to every of the 12 nests wins the game.

184883.description:
Beasty Bar: Tasmanian Devil is a mini-expansion for Beasty Bar or Beasty Bar: New Beasts in Town that consists of four cards, one in each color.
At the beginning of the game, each player shuffles the "Tasmanian Devil" into his set of cards. The "Tasmanian Devil" positions itself in front of all other animals right at the front to "Heaven's Gate". All other cards in line are shuffled and placed randomy behind it. Now the "recurring" actions are carried out.
184883.name: Beasty Bar: The Tasmanian Devil

184884.name: Ghost Dance
184884.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uktena le premier wendigo parcourait la terre des ancêtres
Uktena était un immense et dangereux serpent cornu
Uktena commandait à la foudre et ravageait la terre des ancêtres
Les tribus se réunirent pour chasser le monstre
Les tribus invoquèrent Soleil qui repoussa Uktena dans le monde des esprits
Les tribus purent prospérer en paix
Mais Uktena n'est qu'endormi, un jour peut être quelqu'un le réveillera, quelqu'un le rappellera...
Légende Cherokees
Ghost Dance vous invite à parcourir les États-Unis à la recherche d’un mystérieux groupe décidé à sortir des méandres du passé des forces jusque là endormies.

Ghost Dance contient la description d’une nouvelle réserve indienne et six scénarios complets et prêt à jouer formant une campagne.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Uktena the first Wendigo roamed the land of ancestors
Uktena was an immense and dangerous horned snake
Uktena commanded lightning and ravaged the land of the ancestors
The tribes gathered to hunt the monster
The tribes invoked Sun that pushed Uktena in the spirit world
The tribes could prosper in peace
But Uktena is asleep, one day someone can be awake, someone will recall the ...
THE LEGEND Cherokees

Ghost Dance invites you to visit the United States in search of a mysterious group decided to get out of the meanders of the past forces hitherto dormant.

Ghost Dance contains the description of a new Indian reserve and six complete and ready to play scenarios forming a campaign.

User Summary

A supplement for B.I.A.

A 6 scenario campaign set on an Indian reservation.

184885.description:
Dynamite comes in a very small package in this super-deformed, gem-infused fighting card game.

Pocket N30N City RUMBLE is a dueling card game that simulates colossal battle between teams of tiny street fighters. Players use 3 Fighters to perform a wide array of attacks, combos, counters, and super moves to beat the living gems out of the opponent(s).

Discover your power team by playing solo at the "Dojo" and surprise your friends with newfound skills during your next Tag Team match!
184885.name: Pocket N30N City RUMBLE

184886.name: Showtime
184886.description: In the game it comes to celebrities. For every famous head features must be represented and guessed. You even have to convey these features your team. You may paint, show a pantomime or talk. But you have 60 seconds each time - for five terms

184887.name: Atrapame si puedes
184887.description:
Los jugadores encarnan a agentes de la Interpol que persiguen a los miembros de la banda SCOP por todo el mundo. Para ello dependeran de sus conocimientos culturas de los distintos paises por lo que el criminal va pasando en su huida. Ademas cuando le atrape debera tenerle correctamente identificado.
Ganara aquel jugador que requiera del menor tiempo posible para detener a sus objetivos.

Sistema de juego:
Los jugadores pueden Buscar pista o Viajar.
- Buscar pista: Los jugadores pueden investigar en las diferentes localizaciones de pais donde se encuentran. En esa localizacion le daran pistas sobre el paradero del criminal. Las pistas vienen en forma de costumbres o cultura del pais de destino. Adicionalmente, el jugador puede obtener informacion sobre las caracteristicas del sospechoso. Esta accion tiene un coste de 1 unidad de tiempo.
- Viajar: Cuando el jugador cree conocer donde se esconde el criminal va a ese pais. Luego se comprueba si estaba en lo correcto o equivocado. Esta accion tiene un coste variable dependiendo de la distancia recorrida.
Los jugadores en cada ronda deben recorrer 4 paises para atrapar al sospechoso y para ello disponen de 4 dias.


Players are Interpol agents that must arrest to the members of the CSOD criminal band. For this, they need a lot of knowledge about the countries for the suspect be in his flee.
When the player cath the suspect he must identify him correctly.
The player who need less time to catch his objetives win the game.

Gameplay:

During the game the players can search clues or Travel.
- Search clues means that players investigate in the actual place in one location. This location give to the player a clue about the next destination where the criminal. The clue is about culture of the country where the criminal is. In addition the player can get information about the characteriscts of the suspect. This action cost 1 unit time.
- Travel means that the player knows where the criminal is hideway and go to the country. Then looks that his correct or wrong. This action cost variable time units depend of the distance.
To catch the criminal each round tha player must travel throught 4 countries and He has 4 days to arrest.

184888.name: Rizk
184888.description:
RIZK was created for the National Science Museum to promote Atmosphere, their new exhibition space. The exhibition and game were designed increase awareness of, and to educate visitors about the science behind climate change.

Rizk takes place on an alien landscape, the objective being to grow your plant using the resources you find. How you source energy and defend your plant awakens the resident plants, which threaten your plant’s health.

Seeded on Miniclip, Kongregate, Newgrounds, e4.com and other popular games websites, Rizk had exceptional results in its first 3 months online:
• 3.8 million games played
• 877,698 Absolute Unique Visitors, with an average 15 minute dwell time

Source: The Developer Website.

184889.name: Ya Basta!
184889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ya Basta! donne des conseils pour envoyer les agents de la B.I.A. au Mexique. Ainsi, après une fiction de 2 pages, le premier chapitre (Dossier technique, 5 pages) prodigue des conseils pour envoyer officiellement ou en sous-marins des agents de l'autre côté du Rio Grande. Des considérations sur les degrés de coopération avec les forces locales et sur les méthodes à employer sont également présentes. Le chapitre se conclut par la description de deux agents de liaison.

Le chapitre suivant (Ocosingo, 10 pages) décrit le petit village d'Ocosingo situé en territoire Tzeltals. Les petits secrets du village, des synopsis d'aventure et les personnages importants du village sont donnés. Un nouveau cursus, petit-truand, est également proposé. La description de la région du Chiapas où se trouve Ocosingo est le sujet du chapitre suivant (Chiapas, 4 pages).

Un scénario (Les Serpents rouges, 9 pages) en deux épisodes envoit les personnages des joueurs en mission d'infiltration d'un groupe de narcotrafiquants indigènes. Durant leur mission, ils doivent participer aux luttes de pouvoir qui agitent les malfaiteurs.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Ya Basta! Gives advice to send the agents of the BIA in Mexico. So after a fictional two pages, the first chapter (technical file, 5 pages) provides advice to send officially or submarine officers across the Rio Grande. Considerations on the degrees of cooperation with local forces and the methods to be used are also present. The chapter concludes with the description of two liaison officers.

The next chapter (Ocosingo, 10 pages) describes the small village of Ocosingo located Tzeltals territory. The secrets of the village, adventure and important people of the village are given synopsis. A new curriculum, breakfast mobster, is also available. The description of the Chiapas region of Ocosingo is located is the subject of the next chapter (Chiapas, 4 pages).

A scenario (Snakes red, 9 pages) in two episodes of the characters sends undercover players in a group of natives drug traffickers. During their mission, they must participate in the power struggles which agitate the perpetrators.

User Summary

A supplement for B.I.A. The agent will be sent across the Rio-Grande to investigate in Mexico.

184890.name: Wakan Tanka
184890.description:
From publisher blurb:

Après une page contenant crédits et table des matières débute un ouvrage consacré aux esprits. Le monde des esprits est décrit sur 7 pages, en commençant par rappeler que la diversité des peuples amérindiens ne permet pas de présenter une spiritualité unique. Néanmoins, quelques points communs peuvent servir de base, et en particulier le rôle du Trickster qui bouleverse le monde et suscite l'apparition de héros pour l'affronter. Puis divers esprits sont détaillés, comme les incarnés, esprits qui ont réussi à prendre forme humaine, les porteurs de peau, chamans dévoyés qui emprisonnent des manitous pour obtenir leurs pouvoirs ou les demi-vivants qui sont des cadavres parasités par des esprits. Divers exemples de ces créatures sont proposés, ainsi que des moyens de passages entre le monde des esprits et celui des hommes.

Mythes et légendes occupe ensuite 5 pages. Ce court chapitre propose 3 légendes célèbres et leurs utilisations potentielles en jeu. Il s'agit d'une légende Navajo, Le Premier Homme et la Première Femme, d'une légende Cahuillas, Gravir la montagne et enfin de la légende des Sioux Lakota : L'attrape-rêves.

Pour terminer, Burning sands est un scénario de 19 pages qui permet de mettre en scène certains des concepts abordés précedemment. Les agents du BIA vont devoir enquêter sur d'étranges combustions humaines spontanées. Il leur faudra visiter les territoire des navajos, et se méfier des gangs de motards qui errent sur ces routes. Les PNJ importants sont décrits au début du scénario, en particulier une anthropologue et un officier de la police locale.


Translation courtesy of Google:

After a page containing credits and table of contents begins a work dedicated to the spirits. The spirit world is described on pages 7, starting by recalling that the diversity of Native Americans does not present a single spirituality. Nevertheless, some basic commonalities may serve, in particular the role of the Trickster that overturns the world and arouses the hero emerged to confront it. Then various spirits are detailed as ingrown, minds who have successfully taken human form, skin carriers, shamans who imprison rogue manitous to get their powers or half living corpses that are parasitized by spirits. Various examples of these creatures are offered, as well as passages means between the spirit world and men.

Myths and legends then occupies 5 pages. This short chapter provides 3 famous legends and their potential uses in game This is a Navajo legend, The First Man and the First Woman, a Cahuillas legend Climb the mountain and finally the legend of the Lakota Sioux.: The dream catcher.

Finally, Burning Sands is a 19-page script that allows to stage some of the concepts discussed previously. BIA officials will have to investigate strange spontaneous human combustion. They will visit the territory of the Navajo, and beware of motorcycle gangs that roam on these roads. Important NPCs are described at the beginning of the scenario, especially an anthropologist and an officer of the local police.

User Summary

Item only currently in French

This supplement for B.I.A. explore spirits and the legends and lore for B.I.A. investigators.

It includes a scenario leading to an investigation into phenomenons of spontaneous combustion.

184891.name: Skin Walker
184891.description:
From publisher blurb:

Skin-Walker vous conduira du cœur du Mexique vers les réserves Navajo, en passant par le monde des esprits.

Ce supplément pour BIA des éditions Les XII Singes est une campagne en trois actes au cours de laquelle les nerfs de vos agents seront mis à vif. Ils réaliseront que parfois les écorchures d’une vie peuvent suffire à franchir la barrière de la réalité et faire ressurgir son soi primal. Mais seront-ils prêts à céder à leurs plus bas instincts ? Accepteront-ils de flirter avec leur côté le plus sombre pour parvenir à leur fin ? Jamais vos agents n’auront eu à aller aussi loin pour faire mettre à jour l’horrible vérité : l’homme est un véritable prédateur pour l’homme.

Ne vous fiez pas à ce que vous voyez, la vérité peut à tout moment changer de peau.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Skin-Walker takes you to the heart of Mexico to the Navajo reservations, through the spirit world.

This supplement BIA editions XII Monkeys is a country in three acts in which the nerves of your agents will be made alive. They will realize that sometimes the scrapes of life may be sufficient to cross the barrier of reality and bring back his primal self. But will they be willing to give in to their baser instincts? Will they flirt with their darker side to achieve their purpose? Never your agents will have had to go so far to update the horrible truth: man is a true predator for man.

Do not trust what you see, the truth may at any time change skin.

User Summary

This campaign for B.I.A. will lead the investigators of the Bureau of Indian Affairs to Mexico in Navajo reservations going through the world of spirits.

184892.name: Tawiscara
184892.description:
User Summary

Two parts:

- The invisible peoples
- A 6 scenarios campaign on divisions between clans and families.

184893.name: Gardoches Partout, Justice Nulle Part
184893.description:
User Summary

This supplement for Wastburg includes rules to create the patrol for the district the PCs evolve in, followed by a scenario.

184894.description:
From the publisher's web site:

COMBAT LEADER: SOLITAIRE MODULE allows you to play solitaire using an easy, playable method of play. Includes 20-page, illustrated rule booklet, two counter sheets (E & F), one extra set of Markers, and Map 6 (farmland). Ziplocked.

The rules allow you to play solo any of the original six CL: Eastfront '41 scenarios, with the system playing the German or Russian opposition. Also included are four new Encounter scenarios, especially made for solitaire play.

Finally, a Quick Scenario Generator lets you create your own CL scenarios, quickly and easily. You must own the core rules of Combat Leader: East Front '41 to use this module. You must own the CL: Expansion set to play one of the new Encounter scenarios.

As mentioned, this module adds two new new German and two new Russian squads (plus extra men, and some heavy weapons), extra game markers, and a new map. This is a complete package to expand your enjoyment of this tactical WW2 infantry game system.
184894.name: Combat Leader: Solitaire Module

184895.description: Terra Mystica: Erweiterungsbogen, a promotional mini-expansion released at Spiel 2015, includes the previously released Bonus Card Shipping Value and 4 Town Tiles promos as well as a special landscape for every race and a round scoring tile that gives you four points for building a temple.
184895.name: Terra Mystica: Erweiterungsbogen

184896.name: Where's Waldo? Join The Search
184896.description:
Review by Time for Kids:

"The search for Waldo began 25 years ago. So, where is he? As fans of the books know, Waldo is a master of hiding in plain sight. Now the hunt continues in the Where’s Waldo? Join the Search board game from Techno Source. Arrange the eight game cards in any order, spin the wheel, flip a playing card and race to find the hidden objects on the card. Get your eagle eyes ready: The player with the most cards wins! – Kelli Plasket"

From the publisher:

Where's Waldo? Join the Search Game is fun for the whole family. Join your friends in a race to find to find the hidden objects in this board game featuring the Waldo and his friends. The super detailed scenes are right out of the beloved picture books by Martin Handford. Arrange the game boards in any order. Then spin the wheel, flip a card, and you're off! Fans of the Where's Waldo books will recognize the colorful characters from the Waldo universe. And if you're meeting Waldo for the first time, you'll be amazed at all the ways he can hide in plain sight. Includes an adjustable game board with 12 double-sided tiles, cards, spinner, and game tokens. The game offers a new game experience every time you play. You'll even receive two Where's Waldo postcards with classic book scenes. Fun for 2 - 6 players age 8 and over. University Games offers you and your family a wide selection of creative games that are easy to learn and fun to play.

184897.name: Blood of the Magi
184897.description:
On a distant planet, a lonely God peers over his barren domain. "If only there was an Other."
In that instant, a new race was born, perfect in mind body, and spirit. This new race, the Magi, had awesome powers and could control the elements of Earth, Fire, and Water.
They even manipulated the weather and the fabric of Space-Time.

Preferring the company of each other, the God sent a curse to the planet and attempted to destroy his "failed" experiment. A bloody battle breaks out between groups of these Magi.

Take control of an army of powerful Magi and arrange a battlefield to take advantage of elemental and tier advantages during the bloody battles where strategy, luck, chaotic effects, spells and d6 rolls decide who comes out on top.

A rich variety of spells with effects that range from buffing a Magi to damaging your foe's Magi, stealing their spells, even rearranging their battlefield. A few are powerful enough to resurrect a dead Magi!

Beware! When you have defeated your enemies to be the last one standing, the angry God will descend to the planet to battle you!

Prevent his attempt to eradicate your existence!

184898.name: Lost Heir: A Game
184898.description:
This race to the end board game is based on the popular card game Lost Heir, which was based on the 1872 novel, The Lost Heir of Linlithgow by the widely-read 19th century author, Mrs. Emma Dorothy Eliza Nevitte Southworth (commonly referred to as E.D.E.N. Southworth).

The game comes with a spinner, playing pieces and game board, with spaces featuring characters along the outer edge of the board that look like the pictures on the card game. These spaces give instructions for the players to go to another character, move forward or back, lose a turn, etc. The winner is the player who lands, by exact count, on The Heir space in the middle.

184899.name: Sukkube
184899.description:
Sukkube is an abstract game in which each player represents a character of the circus: The Tamer, the Lion, the Presenter, the Clown, the Strong Man, and the Dancer. If fewer than six players are in the game, assign the remaining positions to the "bots", which will play automatically.

They are distributed, discoveries, five cards to each character.
The cards are played according to the rules.
These cards allow to rotate the cube, which is nothing other than the box itself of the game.

When any character ends his cards, or can not play any according to the rules, the round ends and the character on the upper face of the cube (the Dominator) earns a point. You rotate the cube of 180 degrees and the character that was at the bottom end of the previous round (the Sukkube) is the first to play in the new run. First player to reach 5 points Wins.

The game will test the predictive power of the players, having played all cards on the table.

Seven play variants let you experience different moods.

184900.name: Ophiuchus: The Thirteenth Constellation
184900.description:
Ophiuchus is composed by 27 title cards and 13 cards representing the 13 constellations.

Players, in turn, will place a card next to another card in order to form horizontal or vertical sequences of symbols corresponding to the drawings on the constellation cards. The goal of the game is to accumulate more points than other players.

184901.name: Spellfall
184901.description:
Spellfall is a unique tile-matching puzzle game where you cast magical spells to defeat evil monsters.

Source: The Developer Website.

184902.name: Infallible
184902.description:
A Warning/Exploration/Thought Experiment/Game of the New Young Gods

From the Game Text:

Gods are real. Gods Plural. Gods for everything, for anything important enough fur us to place our hopes and wishes upon. They look and act just like us. Religious texts have it backwards. They are formed in our image. They have names and clothes and foibles. Some even have jobs.

For this thought experiment, you need to imagine a person on the street. A normal person with their own attitudes, opinions, and ignorances. Now give him limited omnipotence, especially over one narrow thing. Something like smartphones or coffee.

Now that you and whatever friends you have present have imagined these hypothetical gods and know a bit about how they work, what do you do? Ah, there's the rub. You're a person with the intellectual maturity of a teenager, or maybe if we're very lucky an early 20 year old. You have absolute power but not much idea how to use it well. What would you do? That's what they do. All the poor decisions and good intentions and selfishness coupled with omnipotence. What do they do? More like what don't they do?

184903.name: Prehistoric Game
184903.description:
The game is based on Ludo. The aim of the players is to feed their dinosaurs.
Two players have 4 herbivorous dinosaurs and two other players have a carnivorous dinosaur. Winner of the game is the player who first had 6 tokens with food and return to their lair with all the pieces.
Herbivores collect tokens by bypassing the round by the board and return it to its lair. Carnivorous dinosaurs get a token every time you step on the same field with another dinosaur.

184904.description:
The savages call it A’hemDaar. Its name is spoken by them with fear and is seen as a bad omen. You have been warned: you are a tiny, tiny thing out there.

This expansion contains 96 additional cards that will greaten the size of the Continent and offer you a new curse to unravel!
184904.name: The 7th Continent: Swamp of Madness

184905.description: 64 card expansion to challenge your video game knowledge.
184905.name: God Hates Charades: 8-bit Expansion

184906.name: Next One
184906.description:
Next One is game like bluff and chicken race.
Players turn over chips and get VP or dead(lose game).
The player who more VP get win this game.

In each turn, players can 2 actions.
1. Turn over chips
2. Put the "chip of gas mask" on a target chip.

If chip that is turn over is "chip of skull", you lose this round.
And it is "chip of peace", you gain 1 VP.

Players play 4 round and the player who have most VP is winner of this game!

184907.name: School'd
184907.description:
From the Introduction:

School'd is a game about trying to thrive when it feels like the world conspires against them. It is a game about depression, uncertainty, fear, destitution, and isolation, but it is also a game about learning, love, friendship, growth, and hope. School'd is a game to tell the story of students, but not the way you see them on TV. The players will not take on the role of the rich kids misbehaving, zany antics, or supernatural students trying to fit in while balancing the hidden world. School'd is a game about real students with stressful home lives attending an inner city school. If you are looking for a game where your character is like the protagonist of a movie or TV show you love, than this is not the game for you. If you are want to play a game just to have a good time, this probably isn't for you either.
